campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We have been in the sneaker business since 2013. Our team consists of very experienced people who have been with us since the beginning. Therefore, it's safe to say we know fabrication better than the average manufacturer. We are convinced that we are able to deliver a high quality product. 

Having spend over 7 years producing all different kinds of MIPACHA's, we also have experience with our fair share of difficulties and anomalies. Should any issues come up, we assure you we will handle them adequately.

We are very excited about this project and we hope you are too! Thank you for your support and we look forward to making you happy with our amazing sneakers!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
campaign.env:
Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Sustainable materials
The sole is made of 100% recycled rubber and the upper is made of 100% recycled PET bottles, with about 30% directly from the oceans and the remaining 70% from coastal areas. It is the first sneaker line that contributes this much to real ocean PET waste in the world.
Environmentally friendly factories
Every sneaker is handmade by experienced craftsmen working in certified ethical factories in Peru & Portugal. They have been making shoes with us since the beginning and have produced over a hundred thousand pairs of shoes.
Sustainable Distribution
We have a holistic vision on sustainability. We think about the entire cycle of the product. So next to using sustainable materials for the production, we also offer CO2-neutral shipping, reusable shipping bags and minimize the use of carboard and packaging.

campaign.story: This project is promoted by Jellop, the ad tech power behind the best Kickstarters with 1000+ successful Kickstarter projects with over $450MM raised between them.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We've come a long way since we started. 

The designs are ready to go, manufacturers have been selected carefully based on our production trip in November 2019, logistics are set and the only thing we need is reaching the MOQ of our unique product.

We consider transparency to our customers priority number 1. So, we will keep our backers posted of the steps we make, just like we have been doing with our email subscribers.

The main steps we will take after launching are:
- Test design in larger productions
- Start mass production
- Quality Control
- Fulfilment
- Customer service
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
campaign.env:
Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Long-lasting design
Using strong material with relatively robust components for such a small design, will boost Bucqle's sustainability. Also the Physical Vapor Deposistion protects the Bucqle against liquid, acids and other damages, moreover this is an environmental friendly coating.
Reusability and recyclability
The steel of a Bucqle can easily be recycled.
Sustainable materials
316 Stainless Steel is known as long-lasting material with a low need for replacement.
Something else
With the enormous growth of online shopping, the number of return sendings has increased significantly, leading to large companies destroying returns since this is cheaper than repacking and reselling. Bucqle is a solution that provides a perfect fit to pants and skirts, even when they have been ordered too large online. This reduces these returns and therefore waste. Bucqle does not only avoid pollution, it also solves the problem!

updates.update_content:
Dear Backers,

A quick update from the Bucqle founders! We have been stuck in the design process for a while. Prototyping and communication take more time than usual.

The bottleneck of the process was all about the locking function, which has been solved now. However, keeping the bar locked was the last bit of a challenge.

Dear Backers,
In our last update, we shared our ups and downs with you, including details from "behind the scenes". We hope to have created some more transparency on our (sometimes difficult) course, as we are on this journey together.
We got stuck at the necessary redesign of the locking system to secure a perfect fitting Bucqle. The good news is: this now got solved! We have developed a very simple and strong system to stop your Bucqle from opening up and fitting perfectly.
Having said that, the locking bar itself should also stay closed when securing this new and improved locking system. It sounds overcomplicated, it is not, but it should be done properly, paving the road for large-scale production at speed and with precision. This seems the last obstacle we are currently working on before we can adjust our molds to the brand-new design and then, finally, we hope to start up the initial production!

Dear Backers,
Since our last update, we did not provide you with a firm delivery date just yet. However, since many of you have your concerns and ask for more information, we decided to explain our quite bumpy design and production planning road we have been traveling for over 12 months now in more detail to give your a view "under the hood".
So let's go and give you the inside scoop. Bucqle exists of two main parts: the front housing and the back housing. Both parts move in opposite directions, so when you put some fabric in-between, it creates a neat fold in a “Z” shape. When you are happy with your fit and settings of your Bucqle, you want to lock it to secure the front- and back housing. Sounds quite simple, but many times a simple idea, or a simple invention, can be quite challenging when you move from a conceptual design into mass production. We sure did not oversee all that complexity, as we have no prior mass-production experience. We are learning more than we would have preferred on this journey and, rest assured, it will benefit you too in the finished product although we fully admit that the time this takes is beyond what we had ever imagined nor did you.

Dear Bucqle Community,
Unbelievable we are writing such an update again. This message though, should rather be considered a positive.
We made a last minute call to prioritize the sustainable quality above delivery speed.
During the production timeline, we were offered a choice to boost Bucqle’s sustainability by replacing our silicone brake pads by stainless steel ones. The brake pads are located between the front- and back housing of Bucqle, activated by the locking bar. When pressing the locking bar, the brake pads will secure the fit of your preference until you unlock your Bucqle. Silicone turned out to wear out after a while, whereas the stainless steel pads will last forever.

Dear Bucqle Community,

Happy new year!

Good news from the team.

updates.update_userinfo: High-level production update from the Founders of Bucqle
updates.update_content:
Dear Bucqle Community,
Please find enclosed a high-level production update from the Founders of Bucqle.
After all complications, with regards to the Covid-19 situation overseas. In addition to the many suppliers and internal issues we had to deal with so far, we are happy to inform you that we recently partnered up with an American team, based in China, that talks the talk and walks the walk.

Dear backers,

Thank you so much for sitting tight and being patient for us.

It has been quite so me headache during the past couple of months. However, we are excited for the upcoming period, since the production process started and we are making big steps towards the delivery.

Dear backers!

Today, we have an important announcement to make. We are checking in on you with good news and bad news.
Let’s start positively! After all the effort we’ve put into the development of the production of Bucqle, we finally got our definite prototype in. The design we’ve been working on in the meantime has been validated and Bucqle 1.5 is a fact. Soon, we are ready to open the molds, start the mass production and deliver to our beloved community.

Dear Backers,
Today is a special day! We have finally filed the new design with our factory. The final prototype is on its way and the preparation for mass production will be starting today!
We could have never thought it would be such a rough journey like this. Like no one else, we could not foresee this situation, neither we took a delay of this long into account.

Dear Backers,
Hope everyone is doing well and perhaps even celebrating some holidays by now! J
In the meantime, Team Bucqle is finalizing the last designs before finally starting the production of molds.
During the past months that Covid-19 was introduced to the world, we kind of had our hands tight with regards to product development overseas. As mentioned in our previous updates, there are significant delays in everything you could think of to get our beloved product into your hands and pants. However, we took this precious time to further innovate the product and optimizing its capabilities. We are therefore happy to announce that we will deliver you the Bucqle 1.5, rather than the initial Bucqle 1.0 design.

campaign.story:
Powered by the World's Best Marketing Partner for Kickstarter and Indiegogo Projects:
Incredible Results From Creators Who Know The Finer Details. Submit Your Project Today!
Uncompromisingly functional.
Solar Wallet is a modern interpretation of the classic bi-fold wallet, bettering your everyday by providing +10 extra hours of charge and tracking features when you need them most. And most importantly: without taking up any of your personal space.
Maintaining the traditional beauty of an Italian wallet, it's hand-crafted with no details left behind. Trust us to make the last wallet you'll ever dream of.
Say goodbye to low-battery notifications...

  On the go. Anywhere.
Recharge with the morning sun or USB, your choice.
One-swipe access for your most used card.
Minimalist but not compromising. Leave nothing behind with 8 card storage and a chrome money clip.
  
  In the 21st century we all have more than one device needing charge...
  As phones remove the headphone jack, we rely on wireless headphones for music. Not only does bluetooth discharge your phone faster, but now we have another battery to worry about.
We've all been there - going to the gym and realizing your headphones are out of battery isn't the happiest moment of your life.
     Our focus has been creating a beautiful, timeless design while also working with the world's best engineers to perfect a piece the majority of the world carries daily.
   The most frequently carried daily devices are your phone and wallet. Your phone has consistently evolved over the past years. Why hasn't your wallet?
Slimmer than ever.
We use the finest quality hand-dressed Nappa leather - it’s so soft, you’ll wish you had it as a pillow to sleep at night.

  Your passport contains the most sensitive information about you.
Theft occurs daily and no longer has to be solely physical. With RFID skimmers, thieves can collect your information simply by walking next to you.
Protect yourself from contactless data and identity theft with our beautiful RFID protected passport holder hand-crafted by skilled artisans.
 
      
Intelligent Charge - we've incorporated advanced circuitry in the main internal board of the battery, allowing you to charge both your phone and wallet at the same time.
Solar Wallet automatically prioritizes charging your phone via pass-through charge and intelligently detects when it's full in order to transfer charge to your wallet.
Android to Apple - have an Apple device and wish you could use your friend's Android charger? With pass-through charge you can use a Micro-USB cable (included) to charge your wallet, and plug your Apple device using the integrated Lightning cable in the Solar Wallet.
    Solar Wallet Specifications
Dimensions: 100mm x 80mm x 13mm ( 3.9 inches x 3.1 inches x 0.51 inches )
Internal Battery: 1500 mAh 
Solar Cell: 50 mA 
Integrated Charging Cable: Apple Lightning, Micro-USB or USB Type-C
Material: 100% Genuine Soft Nappa Leather

TrackR Wallet 2.0™ Specifications  
Dimensions: 54mm x 85.5mm x 2mm ( 2.1 inches x 3.4 inches x 0.07 inches )
Battery Life: 6 months ( user replaceable CR1620 batteries )  
Connectivity: BLE 4.0
Compatibility: iOS 8+, Android 4.4+
Material: Carbon Fiber
3D modeling & prototyping process
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We've spent the past two years perfecting the hardware and design of Solar Wallet. With multiple manufacturers locked in and numerous rounds of prototyping, we've finalized our pre-production phase and are ready to start production.

Scale manufacturing does have challenges associated with it. Negating production delays is a top priority for us. Our team has worked with countless manufacturers before and have visited them on-site, performed individual QC checks and are fully prepared to ensure that we get Solar Wallet shipped out by December 2017.

With your help, we'll get off the ground running after the Kickstarter campaign and begin our production run to get Solar Wallet to you as soon as humanly possible. Thank you!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
The idea was inspired by a 1959 map created by the Architect Constant Nieuwenhuys. He called his idea 'New Babylon.' an imaginary borderless system the size of the entire planet were people can travel without restrictions. (more info here and here )
"The frequency of each man's movements and the distances he will cover depend on decisions he will make spontaneously" -Constant Nieuwenhuys.
-
The World Metro Map
NewYork based Collective ArtCodeData revised this idea to create a map that represents human mobility. The inner life of cities is made of their subways. What would happened if all the lines in the world would be reunited in a single system. Since the tube is the veins and circulatory system of the 'animal-city' if we gather all those possibilities, we could achieve a total circulatory entity?
The result is a digital collage that contains 214 metro/subway systems. Totaling 791 lines and 11,924 stations . Every line in this map represents lines and stations in the real world, however all the lines are interconnected in a way that they all form a mega subway system. You can create routes from Times Square Station NewYork all the way to  Beijing National Library Station in China.
Some of the included cities (see complete list below)
"Everything should remain possible, everything should be able to happen. The environment is created by the activities of life not the other way around. " -Constant Nieuwenhuys (1)
The intersection Between Paris and New York
The intersection between New York, Moscow and Sao Paulo
The intersection between Berlin and Tokyo
Important Note: This map is a Work in Progress, The final result will thoroughly be inspected.
PLAY

The map comes in 2 different sizes, 40x30 and 60x45, size A is the perfect size for rooms and studios, size B is perfect for living rooms and meeting rooms. Both A and B sizes can be encapsulated with museum quality materials to keep them perfect for years ahead.
OPTION 1. Printed in Paper
High resolution print using inks that won't fade and paper that won't turn yellow through the years. The map is sent in a mailing tube and ships anywhere in the world.
---------------------------------------------------------------
OPTION 2. Printed + Acrylic Encapsulation
In case you want something ready to be hanged, the acrylic encapsulation option is right for you. This technique used by galleries and Art museums around the world guarantee high intensity colors and that it stays perfect for years to come.
Who is behind this Kickstarter Campaign?
We are an initiative called "Open Accessibility" selling a map to fund our operations.
And what is Open Accessibility Initiative?
Open access is an initiative created by a group of individuals interested in facilitating travel for people living with disabilities.
How do we plan to reach your goal?
We plan to reach our goal by simply creating a large database of accessible environments in frequently travelled cities. We will accomplish this by physically entering facilities and gathering specifications that make a facility accessible.
But doesn't Google Maps or Yelp have this kind of info already?
No, and that’s exactly the problem, ‘accessibility’ information in online maps and booking websites are extremely ambiguous if existent at all. Our initiative will allow us to gather a minimum of 50 accessible points that will help facilitate travel plans for people living with disabilities.
Some of the aspects we include:
"where is your ramp located? are the door frames and hallways wide enough for a wheelchair? are there elevators in the building? Are the bathrooms accessible? do the bathrooms have one or two grab bars? where are these grab bars located? is there transportation services accessible to wheelchairs on your location? do they have hearing impaired services?"
Why is this important to us?
Because as a fellow traveler we feel that everyone should have the right to enjoy traveling, including the ease of information accessible to travelers. Currently finding information on the best hostel, most accommodating hotel, the best view or even the best continental breakfast is so easy to find. Website blast their cheap prices directly to our emails on a regular basis. However, information on accessibility to a location is still limited. People are left having to call, email and that can be a total waste of time. OA believes that if the need for information about anything that facilitates life is out there then it should be shared.
Open Data
All the data we collect will be available for free under a Creative Commons Attribution License. If you have a computer or Smart phone you will be able to consult it via our website and if you are a programmer you'll be able to connect it to your own website or app via an API.  
What technologies are you using to collect and distribute the data?
We use Myring.io platform to: 
Organize our team of collaborators across US and different countries.
Merge hundreds sources of divergent data into one single dataset
Pay collaborators for collected data.
Manage Data Licenses
Query all our data (Elastic Data)
Expose the data to the world via a REST API
If you are a developer interested in using Open Accessibility Data for your website or App please contact us, we would love to talk with you.

----------------------------------------
Credits:
Image used on the video:
Constant, Symbolic Representation of New Babylon, 1969, Photo Tom Haartsen, ©Constant / Fondation Constant c/o Pictoright Amsterdam 2015
Music :
"Hep Cat jive". Composed performed and produced by Geoff Harvey and Chris Martyn . Visit  http://www.purple-planet.com to know more about this talented musicians.
Notes:
 1. Written by Constant, for the exhibition catalogue published by the Haags gemeentenmuseum, The Hague, 1974.
2. Original Text by Constant:  http://isites.harvard.edu/fs/docs/icb.topic709752.files/WEEK%207/CNieuwenhuis_New%20Babylon.pdf
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
-In order to send the Posters to print we need to gather a minimum of funds. The biggest risk we face is not achieving to do so.

-We want to be able to send the map anywhere in the world, and that's going to be our biggest challenge. Specifically the Acrylic Encapsulation is particularly difficult to package and send. However we are committed to make it happen.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hello Backers, It has been a while since you have heard of us. We wanted to simply contact all of your map lovers and let you know about a campaign we think you might be interested in. Its the Explorer's Atlas!! Its beautiful, full of fun facts and I think a lot of you will fall in love.
Take a look and support 
Best regards, Art Code Data.

Dear Backers 
We are carefully listening to all of you and are taking special consideration of all of your suggestions for current and future projects.....for now we offer the link below where you can find a downloadable color copy of the key for the World Metro Map. 
Simply click on the "worldmetromap key" product and then press download.  The print has been enhanced for better reading.

Hello, Backers and followers, We want to share the creative process behind the World Metro Map with you. We think the process itself was beautiful and have pulled a few screenshots for you to see.  
Below you can see how the entire map was broken up into 9 pieces and individually edited. X-ray features were used to ensure overlapping did not occur and visual inspections along with manual editing was done to connect the stations. In the end each individual piece was then placed on the canvas and voila! The World Metro Map was completed.

The World Metro Map is official done!!!!! We have spent weeks reviewing, adjusting and correcting every line, station, connection and name. Just last night the piece was sent out and its now being printed!!! Excited to start shipping soon.

campaign.story:
Wio Link is designed to simplify your IoT development. It is an ESP8266 based open-source Wi-Fi development board to create IoT applications by virtualizing plug-n-play modules to RESTful APIs with mobile APPs.
The traditional methodology of building IoT applications consists of electronic engineering, micro-controller programming, network programming, IoT protocols handling and application development. Every step involves various hardware and software knowledge and challenges.
This time, we define a new way to create IoT applications. 
No hardware programming. No breadboard. No jumper wires. No soldering. 
3 steps. 5 minutes. Build your own IoT applications!
Thank you so much for supporting Wio Link!  
Here comes our stretch goals and let us know what do you expect for the next! :-)
PLAY

Visual Configuration
Wio Link provides simple visual configuration via mobile APPs to replace the complex micro-controller programming. Drag and drop the sensor tags to certain pins then you can visually set up the hardware.

  OTA (Over-The-Air) Firmware Updates
Wio Link compiles firmware through cloud and can do OTA (Over-The-Air) firmware updates. All the hardware libraries are ready in the cloud and you can proceed with software and applications development directly.


Plug-n-Play Groves
Wio Link connects to the large library of Grove modules. Grove is a family of plug and play, open-source sensors and actuators with standard interfaces as well as various functions. Much like Lego™, it takes an approach of building blocks to assemble a project. No breadboard. No jumper wires. No soldering. 

Note: By now there have been 30+ Grove modules compatible with Wio Link and you can find most of them in the Rewards. We're working to add more continuously. 


IFTTT Application
Wio Link provides basic IFTTT (if-this-then-that) applications for you to interact with friends through Seeed IFTTT Channel. Make the LED strip light up in random colors or set up a reminder of wearing more clothes when it becomes colder. You could create more with Wio Link.
Android & iOS APPs 
Wio Link mobile APPs can be used on both Android and iOS devices. 
RESTful APIs
RESTful API resources let you develop IoT applications easily with the “visualized” sensors and actuators.
 Come and pick up your own package of Wio Link! We have provided the single pack and double pack of Wio Link development boards, the five  different themes of Grove kits and three large sets for friends, workshops and hackathons. There must be a suitable for you.
We've also developed some cute accessories of Wio Link. Just add the amounts to your pledge then we'll send you the mousepads or T-shirts together with the rewards. Please kindly be noted we'll ship the badges and stickers as giveaways to every backer and thanks for your ongoing support! :-)
Wi-Fi Network Protocol: 802.11b/g/n 
Wi-Fi Encryption Technologies: WEP/TKIP/AES
Input Voltage：Battery holder: 3.4~4.2V; MICRO USB: 5V 
Output DC Current: 1000mA MAX 
Operating Voltage : 3.3V 
Charge Current: 500mA MAX 
Flash Memory: 4MByte  
Size:  55mm*48mm 
Weight: 26g
CE/FCC/IC Certified

Xiaobo Ye - Product Management 
Lisa Lee - Money & Meals :-))

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The performance of Wio Link is fully qualified and verified by more than 100 alpha users. Currently it's in the process of CE, FCC, IC compliance and expect to receive certificates in the earlier Dec. The production will be kicked off right after the campaign is completed and we anticipate to ship all the rewards Feb, 2016. And our trustful family member — Agile Manufacturing Center will help fulfil all the quality and quantity requirements on time.

International Logistics

We're proud to have Seeed fans in over 200 countries. We have shipped our products worldwide since 2008. If shipping issues come up, our expert logistics team will help solve problems and deliver Wio Link onto your hands. Please note that you may be responsible for duties, fees and taxes applicable to your region.

Forecasting risk

We’ve done our very best to forecast demand and create a solid production plan with our Agile Manufacturing Center. We’ve dealt with lots of manufacturing projects successfully from Kickstarter and we believe we can handle unexpected events.

Technical support

If you have questions at any time, during or after the campaign has closed, you can always reach us at support.seeedstudio.com/.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Dear backers,
Since we launched Wio Link on Kickstarter, we keeps getting positive feedback from the press, and most importantly, from our users&backers. This means a lot to us as we know people are having a good time building IoT stuff they love.
We promised that we will work closely with community and keep adding more funs&features to the Wio Link, and this time, we are making something big.

updates.update_userinfo: About Delivery Inquiries of Wio Link Products
updates.update_content:
Dear backers, 

Recently we’ve received some inquiries about the delivery of Wio Link products and some friends got back to us for the missing parcels. We’re trying our best for feasible solutions. 
As we utilized the registered air mail service last time and it can be hardly tracked timely, for those who haven’t got the products yet, may we request you to check with the local post offices? If Wio Link couldn’t be found or it has been returned, we’ll send another one to you immediately with better EUB courier service.

Hi Backers!
As many of you started receiving your Wio Link and kits, the next step for you would be to get started and make a project. 
Therefore we would like to invite you to post your project ideas here in the forum.

Hi Backers!
Great news! We have shipped out almost all the Wio Link rewards to our backers, except those who haven't provided us their shipping details, if you are one of them; please confirm your address asap.
We are very happy to see that some of you guys are sharing photos on your facebook, twitter and any other social network, we'd like to thank you for that, it has been a great incentive to us.

updates.update_userinfo: 1,000 Wio Links Are Ready to Ship Now!
updates.update_content:
Hi Backer!
We are excited to announce that our first 1,000 pcs of Wio Link are ready now.

Hey backers! 
Here comes our $150,000 Stretch Goal , check out now!

Hey backers! 
Thanks for your kind support. Mass production has begun, and we will try every effort to speed up the manufacturing and shipping. 
Many of you have asked about Wio Link pre order links. Check out the details here, and don’t forget to share them with your friends who don't have one, otherwise they will borrow your Wio Link. :-)

updates.update_userinfo: Let's Set off a New Voyage for the Year of 2016! :-)
updates.update_content: Hey backers! It has been a little bit quiet since the campaign was funded over, ahem? Some friends asked "What are you guys doing these days?" Apart from keeping an eye on the production of Wio Link and Grove Kits , we were also gearing up for the Seeed Annual Party 2016.

THANK YOU for helping us reach this incredible amount! 
Typed words can only express so much. We are inspired by your great support and encouragement throughout the last month. 
Over $172,422! And more importantly, almost 2,598 backers! You are really the best!
We will try every effort to speed up the manufacturing and shipping. Stay tuned for updates.

campaign.story:
* UPDATE: One extra FREE Things UNO worth €40 with every pledge with a gateway in it! * 
The Things Network community is on a mission to crowdsource a global open and independent Internet Of Things network
Just a few months ago we managed to cover the entire city of Amsterdam  with a new type of wireless network using a technology called LoRaWAN (Long Range Wide-area network). The network was built, from the bottom up, by people like you.
When we started spreading the word about our first crowd sourced internet of things data network in Amsterdam, we got an astonishing response from the global IoT community. Within a few days, groups and companies from Sao Paulo, London, Paris, Sydney, Boston, Manchester, and many more were showing interest in the concept, actively starting open LoRaWAN projects using technology from The Things Network.
This was our proof that an open, global and crowd sourced Internet of Things data network is possible. Not only that, but we did show that we can deploy with an unprecedented speed.
To accelerate this rapid growth even further, and to support our global teams, we have decided to design our own equipment that can help build the network for 20% of the cost compared to other products currently on the market. Both the network’s hardware and software will be open source.
We use Kickstarter to make the products more easily available to our community, backers and everyone else around the world who supports our vision and would like to make their hometown a smart city.
Find out how many people you could be impacting by placing The Things Gateway in your home here.
Products
To help you make the most of this open network, we are offering the following hardware:
The Things Gateway
The main building block of the network. Small, easy to install, it essentially is a router between the things and the internet. With it you are creating the most substantial aspect of your connected city’s network.
About 20% of the cost of any currently available LoRaWAN gateway
Provides up to 10 km / 6 miles radius of network coverage
Connects easily to your WiFi or Ethernet connection
Security through the https connection and embedded in the LoRaWAN protocol
Runs on open hardware 
Contains GPS to determine the gateway’s location and node's location later
Can serve up to 10,000 nodes
One of our BETA test gateways in action.
  The Things Uno 
A network is nice, but how about some device to connect it with? 
Imagine an Arduino Uno with LoRaWAN connectivity. We thought we are using one of the most popular microcontrollers and make it LoRaWAN ready for you to prototype with. 
Upgrade your existing Arduino project and make it wireless with up to 10 km range. How far is your home away from your office? Compatible with Arduino IDE and existing shields. Includes connections for an optional external antenna on the breakout circuit to maximize the range.
Will be shipping pre-loaded with our open source LoRa library, which is also freely available on GitHub.
Oh, and we are collaborating with 3D Hubs for a awesome 3d printable enclosure for your Uno right over here. 
Things Uno with external antenna and 3D hubs printed enclosure!
The first batch UNO's, these are being tested in the field right now!
The Things Node
A matchbox full of sensors, a light and a button. Show off, or just connect this bunch of sensors to your IFTTT account - it is up to you. It is perfect for the prototyping of use cases without the need for programming skills.
The Node includes:
Movement sensor
Light sensor
Temperature sensor
A button
RGB light
Waterproof (IP54) casing
3 AAA batteries supplying power for over a year of usage.
The Node is a versatile device to test or build plug’n’play Internet of Things features. Easy set up as an IFTTT node through our intuitive web interface.
Open source / Open hardware
We believe in Open Source. From the firmware running on the devices up to the hardware designs and casings. We believe that opening this up to the community will benefit us all.
Project costs 
The Kickstarter pledges will pay for design, hardware production, software, backend software and shipment, regulation compliance testing, community and customer management and project documentation so you can see what we are up to.
LoRaWAN - A new technology optimized for connectivity of things
All this is enable by a technology called LoRa. LoRa is a low energy, low bandwidth, long range (over 10km / 6 miles) wireless technology and uses an open data frequency. As we are setting up the network together there is no need for an operator. This amazing technology allows for things to talk to the internet without 3G, WiFi or Bluetooth. No wifi codes, heavy battery usage or worse, monthly subscriptions needed. 
The technology was standardized by the LoRa Alliance and is a result of a collaboration between IBM and chipmaker Semtech. LoRaWAN is currently active on different open frequencies. Most popular are the 868MHz, the 915MHz and the 433MHz. We make a specialised version of every device according to where they will be shipped to. 
Do not worry, we will reach out to you after the campaign to check which frequency your devices need to be based on your local requirements. 
The Things Network is an official member of the LoRa Alliance.
The technology is currently enrolled in France, the Netherlands, Switzerland, Belgium and South Africa. All by larger telecommunication corporations. To make this an open network with no subscriptions we propose a decentralized, crowdsourced alternative to telcos. And to get there we need affordable and open, hardware. 
We already have made working betas. Check out this video of the hardware on our workbench:
PLAY

How secure is this?
Data security and privacy are an essential element of the internet of things and should be taken into account within every aspect of the network architecture: from the nodes to the application server. LoRaWAN uses AES encryption on both the network and the application level using 128 bit keys, with the network keys being unique per node and the application keys being secret. The Things Network offers end-to-end encryption from the nodes to the application server in the scenario where application developers use the Foundation’s hosted routing mechanism and on-premise data handling and decryption.
How hard is it to set up?
The Things Gateway, Node and Uno work out of the box. The Things Network has an easy to use development service available for you to connect to your devices. We are building this so that you should be able to set it up with no help from us.

How does the backend work?
The Things Network community provides open source components for routing and handling of data which is fully compliant with the LoRaWAN 1.1 specification. The two core components in the network architecture are The Things Router and The Things Handler. Packets received from nodes are forwarded from the gateways to one or more Routers as configured by the gateway owner. The Things Gateway is pre-configured with the default Router hosted by the Foundation for plug-and-play deployment. The Routers publish the packets on their built-in MQTT broker. The Router contains MQTT topics for both uplink and downlink packets. 
The Handlers receive packets from Routers by subscribing to, and send data to Routers by publishing to their MQTT brokers. Handlers are responsible for message integrity checking, decryption, deduplication, buffering, transformation and dispatching to application servers. The Handler contains Node RED to handle deduplicated and decrypted data and supports custom processing, also using MQTT publishing. The Handler contains built-in integrations with existing internet of things cloud platforms, including IBM Bluemix, AWS IoT, FIWARE, Parse.com, IFTTT and OpenSensors.io.
For your smart city, innovation campus and everybody else 
At The Things Network, we believe with this project we are taking a big step towards a truly connected future for all devices. We think it has never been easier or cheaper to cover large areas or great distances and we just made it cheaper and easier to use through our accessible and plug’n’play approach to software and hardware design. 
And it will be available to everyone. Now is the time to build an internet from the ground up, owned and operated in a decentralised way by its very users.
Smart Cities
This is your low-barrier chance to get started with any smart city initiatives. All major cities around the world have this on the agenda and you can have access to it with a simple pledge.
Universities
We provide educational packages for universities and schools, complete with teaching materials. A The Things Network community manager will help you set it up, if required.
Hackerspaces
As a hacker space this is an easy and fun way to get started with LoRa. We are creating license-free courses on our GitHub account, that can help you create workshops.
Entrepreneurs
Our Node means you don’t have to have any programming or hardware knowledge to set up your prototype or business idea. LoRa is also a very competitive solution, if you need your own network.
Inspiration for some projects you can build
Pledges
Have a look at the list of pledges we created. If you have any particular idea on a special set of devices that makes a better pledge, let us know, we can be flexible.

Timeline
Everything you see in our graphics, photos and videos is based on previously designed prototypes and working small-batch produced devices. The aim of this campaign is to start mass-producing the next version of these devices. Both us and our partners have years of experience producing and mass-producing software and hardware products.
Team
These products are a joint effort between Tweetonig and The Things Network.

The Tweetonig Team
Tweetonig is a product development agency with a lot of experience bringing connected products to mass production. The senior team working on this project are: John - general lead, Dimer - plastics engineer, Sven  - embedded system engineer, Maurits - software lead and Diderik - open innovation consultant. 
Tweetonig has created mass-produced products like the Glimworm iBeacons and Tuna Knobs DJ Gear, which have already sold worldwide. Now they are bringing their know-how, production and design expertise to The Things Network products.
Johan and Wienke during the launch conference of the network in Amsterdam
The Things Network was founded by Wienke as initiator and Johan as technical lead. Together with the community, they have developed the backend software running on the servers. Find out more about our amazing community here. Johan Stokking has previous expertise by running a sport time tracking company and Wienke Giezeman is a social internet entrepreneur. He successfully founded a video on demand startup (which was sold to a large publisher) and founded Startups for Net Neutrality as an internet freedom activist.
You will see us here
http://schedule.sxsw.com/2016/events/event_PP58120
You have seen us here 
http://thenextweb.com/insider/2015/08/19/the-things-network-wants-to-make-every-city-smart-starting-with-amsterdam/ http://thenextweb.com/dd/2015/10/01/smart-cities-are-springing-up-around-the-world-as-the-things-network-goes-global/ 
http://postscapes.com/nonprofit-iot-infrastructure-the-things-network 
http://www.theinternetofthings.eu/wienke-giezeman-we-crowdsource-city-wide-covering-lorawan-network-amsterdam-its-inhabitants 
https://startupjuncture.com/2015/10/06/how-the-things-network-might-deliver-iots-break-out-use-cases-video/
So that’s our Kickstarter project. Please contribute if you can, or tell your friends and colleagues about this exciting project and even if you can’t contribute, we would love to hear from you.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
LoRa WAN development:
We are already working on LoRa even before the standard was out there. So the team knows what they are doing. Also, all things shown in the video or in the pictures do work. There are off course numerous ugly looking prototypes we kept in the shadow as well. And to make sure we are in the loop for coming changes we will become a member of the LoRa alliance network. 

Timeline:
From earlier products we developed for customers we have a wide network of strong manufacturing, assembly and distribution partners. That being said in product development there is always a risk involved. We do our best to manage those risk while putting these high-tech products through production. Our shipment dates are targets and while we are sure we can meet them, they are still estimates. We will prove continues updates to give all backers a better understanding of the progress.

Component availability and FCC compliant:
Till now LoRa WAN chips are still hard to buy in larger quantities and getting normal radio circuits through FCC regulations to make sure they are consumer safe is even harder. To make sure we can manage we found a great partner that produces these chips ready with FCC approval. This makes sourcing these chips easier and helps us to get these products to you asap.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hi Backers, 
Great news! We have received the first production run samples of the gateways from our factory in Shenzhen. And we did elaborate functional and durance testing. 
We are happy to tell you they all passed our tests! 
It means, that we have given a go ahead to the mass production of the gateways just a few hours ago. Concrete timelines on the distribution and shipping will be communicated shortly.

updates.update_userinfo: Kickstarter Update - Ready to start with distribution
updates.update_content:
Hello Everyone,
This week we received the final samples of The Things Gateway from the factory in China. We are doing the final checks with regards to the firmware and performance at the moment. Once this is finished, we will start with the mass production, which would take around 10-14 days. Amidst all of this, the shipment preparations are also in full swing. We will be reaching out to the individual backers and buyers to confirm the order content and verify the correct address. Do keep an eye out for the email in the following weeks.

updates.update_userinfo: Ready to start with mass production!
updates.update_content:
Hi all,
Just a small update on the gateways. We have passed the certification tests with the latest version of our gateway PCB designs. Great news! The new PCBs are being produced now. Production will begin as soon as they arrive at the factory. We will be reaching out with more updates on this process next weeks.
Stay tuned.

Hello Everyone,
We are going to start the first batch of shipments of UNOs and Nodes the following weeks. With regards to the gateways. For the past few days, our team has been working hard on an issue we ran into during the final parts of the certification process for the gateway we discussed last time. We created a fix and we are now testing internally before going back to the certification process. Very unfortunate this issues only popped up during the extensive testing at our test house. On completion, only the certification for this part will be left. Will keep you posted on the progress.

updates.update_userinfo: Ready to ship the first batch of Unos and Nodes
Start shipment of UNOs and Nodes

@Creator: To add more motivation concerning my comment half an hour ago: the sensors in the 434 MHz band will broadcast a lot of noise in that band if their battery runs low and brings them in a undefined state. Smart Home systems support 434 MHz and 868 MHz and if a sensor is screaming the Hub, or whatever central unit, will be very busy handling interrupts and doing nothing else.

@Creator: Referring to the question of Dag Henrick, since a lot of homes (mine too) are provided with smart things that operate in the 434 and 868 MHz band, I think the 915 MHz band will be preferrable.

Beginners question: From the description of the TTN gateway it is not clear to me, if this gateway will include the queuing/forwarding and routing functionality or if it requires a separate device e.g. raspberry Pi or so, to get it operational

I pledged a lot - still, charging €50 for shipping is ridiculous. There is no such thing as "secure" shipping, that's just marketing talk. All there is, is uninsured or insured shipping, and companies such as DPD and GLS can ship anywhere in Europe for €5 to €15, insured for a large amount (by default €500 to €750, but for a few euros you can have more), and mostly with 1 or 2 day delivery. Really, I and some others are considering to take back our pledge because of this. I wouldn't mind pledging more but taking so much for a commodity as "shipping" is not good. And Wienke, if you really think, "international tracked and secured shipping is just expensive", then you are being ripped off by some shipping company, or the person that looked into shipping didn't do his or her job well. With a volume of orders like this, you will get huge discounts. And even if you didn't do your homework well, if you just ship by PostNL using Verzekerservice within EU, it costs only €20 to €30, insured to up to €5000. But then again, PostNL is very expensive for international shipping and should only be your last resort. PS: and even daring to charge €50 for shipping within the Netherlands? Come on please!

campaign.story:
trim |trim| 
verb [ with obj. ] - make (something) neat or of the required size or form by cutting away irregular or unwanted parts 
adjective - neat and smart in appearance; in good order: he kept his clothes neat and trim
A perfect compliment to your everyday goods
DudeIWantThat: "Thin, fast, and smart in the way we humans like to ascribe intelligence to inanimate objects..."
TechCrunch: "The killer feature is a small square hole in the side that enables you to partially pop out a credit card for a quick swipe."
HiConsumption: (#1 on Best Minimalist Wallets) "After hitting a home run with the first version, Elliot decided it was time to introduce a new and improved version using the feedback from customers."
GearCulture: "The stylish, slimline design puts an end to embarrassing trouser pocket bulging and also enables access to your most used cards without the need to ever take them out. Get swiping."
MovementsandNonsense: "Not only is this wallet thinner, but it’s design allows for one to quickly slide out credit cards for a smooth purchase transaction."
OhGizmo: "Any improvement over the scoliosis-inducing mammoths we carry today is welcome, and the DASH wallet pictured above is one of our favorites."
GearMoose: "...we no longer have room for our oversized, uncomfortable wallets anymore. That’s why we’re personally opting for the Dash Wallet."
Vegetable Tanned Leather - Black
TRIM’s minimal design makes it convenient to take anywhere, from the gym to coffee runs. It can be an everyday wallet, or just your weekend carrier.
The Trim Wallet is only 3mm thick
FEATURES:
Easily trim your wallet
Horizontal slot for easy access primary card 
Vertical slot for up to 8-10 secondary cards 
Keeps bulk to an absolute minimum with a sleek design 
Perfectly sized cash slot for easy access and storage 
Pressed saffiano leather - scratch and stain resistant 
Vegetable tanned leather - heavier hide and threading for leather lovers
Hand oil-coated edges for increased durability against fraying 
TRIM weighs less than .25 oz and is only 3 mm thick.
Saffiano Leather - Black
CASH ACCESS
HORIZONTAL QUICKDRAW
ADDITIONAL VERTICAL STORAGE
The wallet is as versatile as you need it to be. Don't be embarrassed when puling out that old bulky wallet anymore.
Why Trim Your Wallet?
Trim is the perfect size to carry everything you need.
Everyone has one favorite card to use; Trim will give you instant access to it.
In some instances, you won’t be able to use cards, so Trim carries cash.
Pricing starts at only $20 for early birds. That's like a movie and popcorn.
Your clothes will fit better.
They can fit in any pocket or purse.
They can better organize and distribute business cards.
Everyday life can be chaotic. Perhaps this could help make it a bit simpler.
Help make loved ones' everyday lives simpler by gifting one.
Saffiano Leather - Brown

Design & Construction:
Again, Dash brings you a design with a one piece construction that is folded and sewn strategically for the most minimal frame. Starting with the original design, we wanted to have a wallet that combined all aspects that you guys loved. We finally decided on the TRIM design and created a wallet that accommodates both the vertical and horizontal usage. 
Minimal one-piece design
Most wallets have perpendicular slots, which isn't the most effective design. We modified the slots, to have them all at an optimal 30 degree angle, and a curve at the back. This design makes access to the cards easy, but also secure. We did the same for the cash compartment for this wallet. 
First prototype with a straight card slot
The saffiano leather in the Trim Wallet is stamped in a series of cross-hatch designs rendering it very resistant to stains and scratches. This gives us a slimmer frame for a durable construction to help trim your wallet. The edges are then oil-coated to provide more durability and prevent fraying of the ends. Finally, the cash slot is machine laser-cut in a uniform manner.
Saffiano Leather - a pressed leather for a lighter, refined look
We are also providing a black vegetable tanned leather model for a more rugged wallet that builds character over time. This wallet features a thicker hide and thicker threading, with an ultrasuede lining interior. The edges and threading on this model are waxed and coated. There is also additional threading on the cash slot to reinforce the opening.
Vegetable Tanned Leather - Black
Our Story:
Last year, I created the first Dash Wallet project after I couldn’t find the right wallet and I put it up on to Kickstarter. Fortunately, the project was able to get full funding and we were able to lift this venture off the ground. We then assembled an awesome team together and got to work. After months of production, site redesigns, wallet resizing, and logistics organization, we delivered you Dash Wallets, a wallet focused on making your life easier and more organized. We create for the minimalist and hope to slim down your bulky wallets. We do so with the integrity and philosophy of always doing our best to deliver on time, with the best customer service. 
The Original Dash Wallets
After launching the Dash project, we were able to learn a lot more about the many aspects of crowdfunding. We've been working to improve every step along the way from production costs to shipment methods. This time around, backer rewards can be offered at an affordable pledge for better materials and the process of fulfillment will be much more streamlined. We have always delivered Dash products on time and will continue to do so. And again, the design was inspired by you guys. That's the great thing about Kickstarter. Backers and creators can collaborate to create and deliver better products together. So thank you, Kickstarters.
Production:
After numerous assessments on fabrics and blueprints, we have finished designing the wallet using only one piece of material to ensure a minimal frame and durability for a final prototype. We can now start production of the wallets for the public. If successful, the timeline will go as follows:
Week 1-2: Gather information through surveys 
Week 3-4: Organize logistics to start manufacturing
Week 8 : Quality control and checkpoints
Week 9-12 : Shipment to Kickstarter backers
Navy Saffiano Leather
Your Support:
This is where Kickstarter comes in again. We need your support to launch this line of wallets. We are raising funding for manufacturing, packaging, and logistics for the TRIM Wallet. Your support for the production of these wallets will help to make wallets trimmer all around you. Thank you for taking the time to check out the project.
Sharing it with loved ones takes only a second, and it would mean the world to us. Join Team Dash!
Hi-Res Gallery: Here
Awesome song by Rob Simonsen - "Return To Your Ladyfriend"
For further information, media, and a gallery, refer to: www.dashwallets.com
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
If the Trim Wallet gets funded, we will have to make sure everything goes according to plan to meet the promised deadlines. Projects often have trouble completing production and meeting the expected deadlines for shipment. The project could face possible challenges if the quality of the product or packaging does not meet our requirements. However, I will personally be in charge of assembling and shipping all of the pledge rewards as soon as we reach our goal. We will not be outsourcing the post-production work to another company. Our team is experienced and has been preparing for nearly a year to ensure that post-funding will be like clockwork when the time comes. Although we do not see any direct risks and challenges, there are always indirect or unseen tasks that may present itself during the process of productions. We hope to run everything as streamlined as possible and also ahead of schedule.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
"the award for cutest wearable goes to… Moff! "
"It's kind of a do-anything noisemaker, which we're sure parents will love."
PLAY

Examples of play: 
Guitars  / Tennis / Toy swords  / Toy guns / Magical sticks  / Toy golf  / Piano / Marimba / Toy airplane / Hero play and much much more... Possibilities are limitless.
The Moff band connects by Bluetooth to your iOS device, Setting up Moff is as easy as downloading the Moff app onto your device.
Compatibility
iPhone4s, iPhone5, iPhone5s or iPod touch (over 5 generations)
iPad (over 4 generations), iPad mini or iPad Air
As of now, unfortunately, Moff does not work with Android. However, in near future, it will work with Android, too.
Specifications
This device is covered with soft and strong silicon in order to make it safe for kids!
We are close to mass production. The Moff that you see in the video is a real, working prototype. We've been developing it in collaboration with our partner factory. Our prototype has been optimized for mass production.
Time schedule
Below is the timetable of the research, development and production
Time schedule
Development and design history
We iterate prototyping and user tests.We develop and design our prototype to be easy-to-use.
Development and design history
We applied for a patent in Japan and a provisional patent in the US.
With your support, we can bring Moff band onto wrists. While we're close to entering production. And your contribution will help fund:
Production tooling (e.g. mold)
Large component orders
Certifications related to Bluetooth
The Moff band is made in Japan.
Pledges and rewards list
 For developers / companies
For developers, SDK will be available. You can develop and sell your apps in our app store, or you can use our sensing platform and connect it to your own apps. Moff will extend user experiences of your apps.
For companies that have content or characters (including sounds and voices), you can offer them in our app store, as your own apps or materials for users' customization. Moff will extend the possibilities of your own content and characters, and you will get more fans worldwide.
Akinori Takahagi  
Hardware product planning and Marketing
I have enough experience of hardware's / software's product management.I worked at Mercedes-Benz as a product manager of sports models for several years. And I've launched several IT services.I'm in charge of product planning, the product design, production management and marketing of Moff. I'm father with 1 kid.
Motohiro Yonesaka
Apps and cloud engineer
He has enough experience of apps and cloud development. He worked at IBM as an IT specialist. And he has developed several iOS / Android apps, web services. And he is a researcher of sensing analysis. 
He develops sensing analysis, iOS apps and cloud. He is father with 1 kid.
Keisuke Suzuki 
Hardware engineer
He is a circuit designer and firmware and Android application developer. He has developed several robots, wearable computers and circuit boards with BLE, ARM and FPGA. He is in charge of circuit design and firmware development. He loves to talk about newer technologies.
Dr. Tomy Kamada
Advisor
Tomy is an advisor of Moff, mentoring the team to prepare this Kickstarter project. He is a co-founder and former CEO of ACCESS Co. Ltd. Today he is running TomyK Ltd.- Startup Booster, which actively supports young innovative startups.
In addition to the above core member, several engineers and designers are supporting us.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Our risk and challenges are related to the structure and the mold of a silicon case and a plastic case. In order to change a coin battery, the plastic case has to be detached from the silicon case. The ease of changing depends on the structure of both the silicon case and the plastic case.

In order to overcome this challenge, we've started to make and examine trial molds and prototypes in collaboration with our partner factory.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Hi all,
We are happy to announce new sounds for the happy holiday season!
Moff will launch new sounds to get kids and parents into the holiday spirit—including "Handbells", "Chimes" and "Holiday Air Guitar". Moff Band users can then play popular holiday tunes, including “Jingle Bells.”

campaign.story:
Introducing: Poquito
Poquito is the result of our search for the perfect slim wallet. Not able to find a wallet that lets us carry the ‘in-between’ coins, we decided to make Poquito. A front-pocket wallet that carries your essential: cash, cards, and even coins. A little more than most, yet just enough to maintain a slim profile.
It is precision machined from one solid piece of wood - with a custom molded elastomer strap that securely holds everything in place. Each and every Poquito wallet is hand polished, making it a pleasure to handle all-day everyday.
Wood Selection
Black Walnut
Grains are usually straight but patterns such as curl, crotch, and burl can also sometimes be seen. With a moderate natural lustre that will develop patina shine with use. Colour can sometimes have a grey, purple, or reddish cast. Black Walnut is rated highly in terms of durability and decay resistance. Sustainably harvested in Ohio, Midwest US.
White Oak
Colour can vary from nearly white to light brown. Olive cast is often seen with prominent ray fleck pattern. Grain is coarse with larger pores - a prominent feature on Oak. White Oak is very durable, and is often used in boatbuilding. It also has a mellow odour common in Oak, that most people find appealing. Sustainably harvested in New York state, US.
Black Cherry (Subject to Stretch Goal)
Close grain and smooth fine texture. Mostly straight but curly grain patterns are not uncommon. Over time and with exposure to light, the wood will darken into deep golden brown. Black Cherry is well known for being an all-around wood in terms of durability and workability. With high resistance to decay. Sustainably harvested in Ontario, Canada.
Poquito's quick access groove lets you get to a frequently used card with ease.
White Oak & Black Walnut
Molded elastomer strap to securely hold up to 6 cards and some cash (Inside and outside)
Pledging for Additional Strap
Each wallet comes with one strap as a standard (unless we get to our 1000 backers stretch goal). If you'd like to get an additional strap/s please follow the guide to pledge the correct amount:
Coins are inevitable. We made a little compartment for it - just in case
Precision machined wood interior
The Madera logo is debossed on the strap and laser-etched on the wood.
Our Story
A Modern Wallet
For us the ideal wallet is a wallet that we enjoy having in our pocket, feel in our hands, and that simply works. We want something to help us carry 'enough' of the essentials without bulking up our pocket. Poquito is the result of a year designing, prototyping, and refining every details. Making it something we truly enjoy using - everyday.
By backing this project you will help us to make our first order and pay for the tooling with an experienced manufacturer. Ensuring the highest of quality and control in production.
Wood & Sustainability
Wood apart from being one of the oldest material known to man, also leave behind smaller carbon footprint and in some cases negative footprint (trees use and store carbon to grow). Requiring less to process in comparison with leather or metal - and continues to store carbon until it is released by burning it.
Every Poquito wallet is heat treated, precision cut, hand polished and sealed - to ensure a wallet that will compliment you for years to come.
Madera = Wood
Our passion for wood drives us to challenge the convention of what is possible with wood products. We believe in simple and honest design that works to improve our everyday life. We want to make products that create lasting relationship with the users. Wood objects that are made to be loved and to last.
Process & Materials
We set out to create an open-back shell and rubber strap wallet with ultra simple construction that eliminates unnecessary dividers. With this we wanted to make sure that the cards will still be highly accessible. We prototyped countless straps to ensure the balance between elasticity and reliability. Opting to use molded rubber straps instead of woven elastics for better control in production.
Walnut, Oak, and Cherry are well known for their workability and resistance to decay. An important factor for us to consider - as the wallet will be exposed to humidity, contact, and everyday wear.
An early aluminium sheet mock-up
Production Schedule
After a few months of intensive prototyping, we have arrived at a finalised form/function that we are satisfied with. With a successful project at Kickstarter, we will rapidly move to manufacturing and delivery.
December: Final product refinements. 
January: Finalise manufacturing requirements & place order. 
February: Quality control procedure. 
March: Final QC checks and delivery.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We have dedicated countless of hours working together with an experienced manufacturer - trying to mitigate as much risks in all aspects of the product. Although we understand that there will be unexpected challenges along the way, we are confident that we will be able to deliver as per our projected plan.

With mailing in larger quantity there are always going to be risks. Despite this we will always keep our support line open, and let our backers know of where everything stand.

We'll keep things transparent and inform our supporters of any hurdles/delay along the way. We thank you for your support and we look forward to have you on board.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hi Kickstarters! We're back!
We can’t thank you enough for your previous support in turning our idea into a product that's currently used and loved by many. Madera couldn’t have done it without you! And now we're ready to share our latest project with you and we think you’ll love it. The Convoy Wood Case for the iPhone.

updates.update_userinfo: Introducing our iPhone Case Collection: Convoy
updates.update_content:
Hi everyone!
It's been a while since our last update and we hope you're all doing well. Today we'd like to introduce the newest addition to our Madera family.
A Hardwood & Elastomer iPhone Case

Hi everyone!
Thank you again for all the amazing support. You have been most kind and patient with us at this stage of our campaign. We have been receiving so much love for the Poquito, so on this update we'd like to take the relationship to the next level with tips to care for your wallet. Call us demanding.
#1 Prestretch the rubber strap
When you first get your Poquito, the rubber strap may come a little stiff so stretching it will help the rubber to work better. It's small thing to do but it will make your Poquito smoother to use (without hurting yourself or the wallet). Click below to watch our little video.

Hi Everyone,
We have sent out the BackerKit survey over the weekend and over 80% have filled theirs! So thanks to everyone who have done so and this update is a kind a reminder for those who haven't or aren't aware of the survey.
If you haven't received the invite to the survey yet - please message us directly on Kickstarter or contact the helpful guys at BackerKit on support@backerkit.com
