campaign.story:
YOUR SMART HOME ON YOUR SMART PHONE – DESIGNED BY YOU! 
We call them smart-homes because they're trendy, convenient, and stylistic. But wouldn’t it be even smarter if it were yours?
PLUGAWAY produces simple-to-use, super affordable Smart Plugs & LED Bulbs, that let you wirelessly control and monitor your home from your phone - Even better, it will be open & firmware free. 
PLUGAWAY hardware. It's everything our backers wanted and it's here! 
We studied many of the smart home electronics available today and made PLUGAWAY more compact, more intuitive, more open, and most importantly, much more affordable than anything else out there!
Plugaways already come with a pre-built, free app for the Android and iOS - it has all the basics and is so simple to set-up, it's anxiety-free!
Yet we've gone even further: We have decided to let everyone, including small firms, interior designers, developers, restaurant owners, even hobbyists, build an app in their own style with limitless functionality, share their skins on our website and brand the software with their logotypes. In short - to give it your personality. 
Simply connect it to any appliance(s) you want, and start Plugging Away!
Within moments of taking a PLUGAWAY out of the box, it syncs with your Wi-Fi network and gives you these basic, simple and clear functions:
Some Practical Examples of using PLUGAWAY...
You're late for work and running out of the house. With PLUGAWAY you can relax. Why? 

-> Because with a single tap on your smartphone, you can switch off or on anything you want in your home - by category (such as living room or bedroom) or specifically – like the coffee maker burning that leftover brew in your kitchen!
Or what if you keep receiving those electricity bills that just don't make sense, or your family restaurant really needs to be more economically efficient?

-> Now you can know exactly what is costing you what, by hour or day or month…we're already started looking at a 3-phase smart plug for those big pizza ovens, if you thinking what we're thinking :)
Or what if you want to personalise various moods for different occasions like movie night, party time, or even something more personal?

-> with PLUGAWAY, you can easily set any theme presets that you want, and by simply tapping that theme, your home will take on your personality. 
Select (or schedule) any mood you've set up for yourself!
Here’s the BIG DEAL of being OPEN:
We're finalising the hardware (waiting for your feedback) and readying it for certification and production. But we'd like to go one dimension further. 
We want to make this completely open - yes - that means…
1. Sign it and make it your own: Great for interior designers, restaurant owners, or developers who want to create their own brand. Have your own logo on the app.
2. Bundle your own app: pre-select any features you want, or will ever need, from our open library - just drag&drop presets, settings, skins, and click 'compile app'. 
3. App sharing: Create you own rules and develop your own app to share with other Plugaway users!
4. Integrate it: Link it with anything you can think of - this means IFTTT or pair it with your existing smart-home devices or systems (as long as they're open too)
5. Secure it: As secure as it is, maybe you want additional settings or passwords, adding users - limited or full control - it's really up to you!
6. Dream it: So, here's the real point. It's entirely up to you what you want to do with it. It's not about having a "Plugaway" brand on your smart plug or phone app. Give it your name, we don't mind - it's yours! :)
Hearing about our smart LEDs and open app, video production company Goldshore Media (GS|M) have already shared with us their thinking about where lighting can go. Check this out:
Amazing possibilities of our open app and hardware!
Some more examples... 
Social sharing of themes/skins/moods/actions/firmware, and developers corner, will be available on www.plugaway.co. Look out for news of its opening!
Our open software means two things. Developers are able to integrate other devices into the app and share their add-ins. The other is that Plugaway will also be compatible with other systems, so you don't even need to use our app unless you absolutely want to! Provided your existing system is open, you may use the Plugaway app's API to connect with your current home-automation system.
Kickstarter is all about empowering the entrepreneurial spirit and gearing creative ideas into real action. It does this by facilitating communication between creators, encouraging the sharing of ideas, and helping us to support each other. It’s easy for a big business to consume and dominate a market. However, we believe that we have something here and we want to share it with you. We want our homes to be ours, and not some corporate machine's. And we believe that you want the same.
We don't want to govern the function on your app, that's why we're asking you to help develop it. We don't want to brand your home. We want you to be able to personalise your home.
We are doing Kickstarter because of you. Our goal is to raise $50,000. This money will not be used for covering protoyping, production, or material costs. Rather, we will be building on your Kickstarter comments, feedback and pledges, and reinvesting it into the project to make Plugaway the most awesome and open smartplugs and smart LED's on the market. This looks like:
(60%) passing BS, CE, UL and more quality certification standards
(20%) paying software engineers to continue improving the app and make it open
(10%) developing an online library for sharing designs and ideas
(10%) Kickstarter commission and tax 
We also need you to help us share this dream. The only way for us to do this, is with your help and support.

Every comment and pledge counts. 
As said in the video, smart homes are really amazing but many feel that existing systems are too costly, bulky and limited.Our journey starts from a humble beginning; from a married man with a dream. Encouraged by his wife to follow his personal passion for entrepreneurship, mobile technology, and Wi-Fi connectivity, Richard Cai invested his personal time and energy to free-up his home, and put it onto his smartphone.
These actions birthed the PlugAway Project. Initiated under a personal conviction and desire, PlugAway has changed from being a personal dream to a shared vision by a continually growing group of people. Now, we’re inviting you to join the journey! That’s why we are handing you a new, simple and transparent device that you can personalize and call your own. After all, it's for your home!
Of course the pledges are important and we could not continue without them, but we also want to hear what you guys think about our product and ideas. Don't hesitate! Feel absolutely free to contact us with any questions, comments or ideas you may have. We will be grateful for any feedback and will do our best to answer any message as soon as we can.
Looking for more app pics or insights into the hardware? We’re going to be posting video updates on our Facebook and Youtube pages with more peeks into the real deal as it's happening.
3rd November 2013, EVENT Update
PRODUCT DEVELOPMENT UPDATE #1 - Setup
 5th December 2013, Project Update
 1. THE SMARTPLUG SHELL
We started by creating a big prototype. Shortly after that, we made it into a working smart plug! However, because our backers came with so many good ideas, we decided to pause our previous campaign, and implement all those suggestions. Think we've done it this time!
[2012.12.10] From Conception to Creation!!
[2013.03.15] Time to put the big thing into a smaller thing
[2013.04.03] With all the components ready, we put it all together
[2013.04.15] Our first version of the Plugaway - ver.1.0
[2013.07.15] We took your feedback and returned to the drawing board...
[2013.07.26] And we came up with this! The Plugaway ver. 2.0
[2013.08.09] Then we modified our design for international markets
We've made Type-F, Type-I, Type-G, & Type-B plugs
The above pictures show hollow shells and for reference only. There'll need to be certain changes made, such as inserting the PCB! The pictures show appearance and dimensions, we'll need to add grounding pins and do some further work before the Schuko plug is ready.
Because of our backers support, we were able to make a black casing as well!
Our aim is for the smartplug itself to run on only 0.2W and as we are still prototyping, this will need confirmed in a later update. Prototypes are supporting 2500W. In a home scenario with a regular small stereo with standby wattage at 6W, annual energy saving could equate to 53.2kWh at $4.82 saving. Larger appliances such as ACs and TVs can drain several dollars per day if not turned off. Modern appliances are increasingly energy efficient, however energy prices have risen 150% in the past 10 years (UK) and are continuing upwards!
Fridges and freezers may also be connected to Plugaway. Not that you’ll turn them off. But if your freezer breaks down, wouldn’t it be nice to receive a Plugaway alert message before you lose everything in the freezer? Depending how well you stock your freezer, that alert message could save over $100’s.
Our current Plugaway units are single input devices. You may connect a power strip into a Plugaway, though this will control all appliances at once. We are considering a power strip as a stretch goal. Though more on this in an update later.
2. THE PLUGAWAY PCB
[2013.02.02] We designed our first circuit board
[2013.07.03] After our first Kickstarter campaign, we made it smaller
[2013.08.03] We also incorporated your suggestions about adding an LED ring
[2013.09] We all love the colour spectrum of the led-ring - so we've it the best with fiber optics!
Our shell exterior is complete and we're finalising the PCB - making sure to take on board your comments as we do. We've already received some great feedback and will be considering some changes as follows:
CAPACITOR: Our prototype pictures show a combination of capacitors (models: 1000U DIP_2.54, 100U X1210, and 1U X0603). However, as we will be applying for RoHS, which relates to the material composition of components, it also infers a consideration towards component quality. We recognise that this inference currently does not align with the quality of capacitor in our shown prototypes and feel that a higher grade capacitor will better ensure long-term durability. We shall confirm our final capacitor selection in a pending update
CPU: For similar price optimisation, we have chosen the ATmega128 CPU as it utilises a low-power AVR 8-bit Microcontroller and offers a performance that satisfies all of the requirements for efficient control. During prototyping, we have emphasised design, quality and stability. Though we recognise that energy efficiency is important for providing maximum value to you as a user. We will be exploring ways to further improve its energy consumption before release. Our aim is for 0.2W, but this is subject to change depending upon further modifications. The question concerning balance between efficiency and affordability is a critical question, and we take great care when making our decisions.
WIFI CHIP: The above pictures show connection to an 802.11b/g network via a Marvell 88W8686 Wi-Fi chip, originally chosen due to lower cost (meaning cheaper prices for you). However, our final model will connect to an 802.11n network to offer increased range. The exact Wi-Fi chip to be used is still to be determined. Furthermore, our choice for Wi-Fi technology over bluetooth permits increased range and allows each Plugaway to have a separate IP address, offering potential for 252 Plugaway’s to be connected to a standard single household network. 
3. THE SMART LEDS
The internal LEDs are type 14x3528, and are shelled within an aluminum electroplated cooling housing with a silver finish.The bulb is custom made by Iwan to overcome common heating problems. 

A key component of this cooling principle is to use the ectoplasm aluminum due to its higher heat disapation and ability to direct heat away from the LEDs faster than other materials
[2012.12] Iwan checks out the cooling body on his first prototype
[2013.08] We explored the opportunities of making a Smart LED
[2013.09.06] We made the PCB even smaller and tested it with LED bulbs..
[2013.10.11] Our smart LED bulb, looking good so far...but more still to be done
The custom made frosted acrylic LED bulb is fully compatible with each of the out-of-the-box features above (scheduling, energy monitoring etc), the LED bulb uses just 6Ws of power and an estimated lifespan of 30,000 hours. At a 450-500lm output it compares to a regular 50W halogen bulb, thus able to provide energy savings of 85%. It also has an A++ energy label and its E27 fixture is the most regular and common bulb fixture around. What does E27 mean? Named after the designer, this 'Edison Screw' (E) tip bulb has a diameter of 27mm (27).
Iwan has been experimenting with a wide range of bulb designs since 2004, which has seen him work on some interesting projects including a car showroom, underwater pool lights, and just plain old weird architecture, as well as regular interior design projects. The bulb used for this project was first prototyped by Iwan in December 2012 (as shown above). Following Plugaway's first Kickstarter campaign, Iwan and the Plugaway team started collaborating together since June to produce the smart LED (name to be chosen by you!). Plugaway then utilised Iwan's LED design expertise and modified their wi-fi technology to fit the PCB inside the bulb, as well as offer a dimming function and are working on an RGB control option that will be fully revealed in a coming update. Footage from the first public demonstration will be uploaded on Youtube in mid-November. This Kickstarter bulb is just the first of many more designs to come. As further suggested below, we'll be looking together at integrating the LEDs into the default Plugaway app.
4. SMART-PLUG POWER STRIP
What's in the power strip?
4X plug sockets (same geographical regions as regular smart plug)
1X heat sensor (for monitoring room temperature)
2X USB slots 

Each plug socket may be individually or group controlled from the smartphone app, or manually on the power strip. Each plug socket will have its own LED to indicate the socket state (on/off) Regular USBs use 500mA, but we’ll look to offer up to 1.5A support (5volt and 7.5watt). As such, we’ll have compatibility with an increased range of devices. The possibility of offering a USB data storage feature was also suggested. This sounded great. But to do this would require upgrading the CPU to handle data transfer, which would then require additional power for operation. As one of our key points is to reduce power consumption and facilitate energy saving, we seek to minimise our own power demands. There’d also be additional security issues being raised during data transfer.
For the power strip, we won’t personally be financing the development and will be looking for Kickstarter to cover the development costs. As such, we have budgeted a small margin into the pricing to cover arising costs. Equally, we’re continuing with our theme of affordability, so we’ll be noticeably cheaper than the majority of other smart power strips out there.
The general consensus has been favourable towards the classical power strip shape rather than a curved or cubed shape. We particularly like the succinct reasoning of Mark Rutledge, essentially highlighting factors including design speed, development cost and design complexity, as well as the regulatory environment, as favouring the classical strip.
You can read more on the progress in our updates
5. APP DESIGN
Whilst the Plugaway switch looks good, our free app is the backbone and central nervous system for everything that we're doing! We've spent (and are still spending) hours on optimising our app from a three-pronged approach that balances aesthetics, functionality and simplicity.
[DIM/SWITCH] App Prototype ver 1.0, New concept, Prototype ver 2.0 (right)
We're currently developing for Android and iOS, but we aspire to have Windows available by summer 2014.
You can see from the above app shots that we have come a long way since our first prototype, and we're looking forward to showing you more as we progress throughout this campaign. 
Our summary schedule is:
Present - Jan 2014: Complete our freely downloadable app with core functions
Jan - Mar 2014: Develop a 'creative space' and open library on our website 
Feb - Mar 2014: Application to Google Play and the App Store
Apr 2014: App release...time to party!!!
We will also be providing free server access so that you can store your energy history. And just in case anybody is wondering, the smart plugs and lights will all be compatible with the app!
5. FACTORY PRODUCTION
The Plugaway Project is overseen by Torrap Designs Limited, a public company registered in Australia. However, we're operating from mainland China. Why???
One of the biggest challenges for many hardware companies/projects is finding reliable, stable and suitable partners - particularly at the production level! We approached this challenge with simple logic, build a relationship with the factories. To do this, we set-up our office just a 45 minutes drive from two of Beijing's factory districts, employed locals, and make frequent visits.
Rather than frequently fly between continents, we changed continents!
We want our partners to work together to create a quality driven and sustainable supply chain. Being close to our future production partners is not merely enough. We require an Initial Factory Audit/Inspection as part of our factory selection process. The objective is to assist us with conducting due diligence throughout our supply chain; as we ourselves continually strive to meet our aim of being transparent and accountable to our multiple stakeholders. Our Initial Factory Audit/Inspection evaluates the capability of a Factory to produce products within a consistent and sustainable Manufacturing process.
Within the context of the above statement, sustainable refers to two areas. Firstly: a Factory’s convergence with statutory United Nations (UN) and International Labour Organisation (ILO) conventions and documents on areas such as Safe, Healthy and Hygienic Working Conditions (ILO Convention No.155 and ILO Recommendation No.164); Adequate Wages and Compensation (ILO Convention No.26 and 131); No Excessive Working Time (ILO Convention No.1 and 14), and other areas as deemed appropriate. Secondly: a Factory’s environmental and energy use procedures. In relation to TS 16949, Factory’s should be able to demonstrate a strategy for waste reduction, improving electrical and energy efficiency, and responsible purchasing – at very least in areas pertinent to Torrap (our name).
Manufacturing process relates to the Manufacturer’s Quality Management System, Assembly Line, Inspection and Testing Procedures, and Facilities and Equipment. In addition to our own onsite visit, this is importantly inferred through current receipt of relevant certification standards, such as ISO 9001.
During prototyping, we have printed our PCBs with Beijing KDS Electronics Co., Ltd and our shell with Beijing Rapid Precision Tooling Co., Ltd. They are each well recognised and between them produce for companies such as Audi, Panasonic Electric, Sony and Volkswagen. Any changes to our suppliers will be disclosed within future sustainability reporting
A note on certification: Assurance of quality goes well beyond receipt of certifications. However, we will still be applying for certification for each geographical market: America (UL498), Australia and New Zealand (AS3112), Britain (BS 1363), China (CCC) and Europe (CE 7/7). Note that some countries may not be covered under these certification standards. We will additionally opt for application towards a material certification standard (RoHS) and environmental standard (WEEE).
Free Developer Kit to ALL!  
We're offering all of you an open-access zone where anyone and everyone can build their own styled and self-branded app. This will include an open access library that offers a range of presets for you to bundle together as you please, and also provides a space for you to show-off your app interface, skins, etc., and share it with other Plugaway users.
Pledge levels
For those who missed the early bird 20% discount rate, don't worry, Plugaway devices are still available at a great value.
Timely fulfilment of our pledges to you means a lot to us! We endeavour to meet all of our commitments to you and promise to notify you in the event of any change. 
And remember, you can top-up with more devices later!
Wanting Plugaway as a gift?
Christmas is coming & the New Year is around the corner. Giving always has a sense of excitement! So we’ve decided to design a few template gift cards for you to freely download, print off, and fill-out.
Right-Click on your mouse as "Save Link As.."

Iwan also has 7 years of project management experience with the Netherlands’ Ministry of Defence, as well as being a Director of Engineering position at GSM Service Aalten in 2003 – 2004. campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Ensuring your safety: In addition to encrypting the system coding and utilising a secure and nationally leading internet service provider. Plugaway devices may be further protected by three rounds of passwords. First, your household Wi-Fi network password is required. Second, you can apply a password to your app. And thirdly, you can assign a password to any individual appliance. This for example, allows you to share control for all appliances with anyone you choose just by sharing your passwords; whilst, for example, also being able to prevent them from playing pranks and waking you by turning on your bedroom light during the night!

Maintaining stability: Plugaway uses a server for three reasons. Firstly to allow phone control beyond the scope of your home network. Secondly, each device has a memory span of approximately 6 months. To ensure efficient operations, we upload information to the cloud and refresh the memory of your device. Third, few people have access to a personal server, so we provide server access for free. 
Although we'll be looking at renting space on international servers prior to launch (such as amazon), our current server is operated by WanWang (www.net.cn) in Zhejiang Province, China. This is for practical reasons as we have been developing the project in China. Well recognised as China's leading internet services provider, WanWang has one of the worlds’ top IDC rooms with independent IP, optical access and line redundancy, INTEL multi-core server platforms and a DDT backup system. This is accompanied by its real-time monitoring system and equipment maintainance, supporting its 24/7 operational guarantee. Utilised by China's equivalent of Google (Baidu), Youtube (Youku), Twitter (Weibo) etc, WanWang's operational stability has a direct influence upon China's economic stability. As such, WanWang provide a 24/7 operational guarantee, and report 365 days of uninterrupted service annually. In the unlikely event of a server crash, your Plugaway devices will remain operational. However, we have programmed a default safety feature that will only permit recognised and secure networks to control your devices. This will usually be limited to your household Wi-Fi network. We shall review our international server selection before final launch and - in a similar style to above - provide rationale behind the decision. Note also that there's no obligation to use our server, it is simply there as a free service to regular users without their own personal server. Just use the on/off option within the settings menu
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Dear backers,
On Friday 28th February, we released an Update informing you of the decision to cancel the Plugaway Project. This has resulted in understandable disappointment within our backer community. Following the release, several backers have suggested publicly uploading project files. The team fully supports this suggestion and has compiled and uploaded files for shared viewing. In respect to the files provided, we ask that any project built on or incorporating the given content will return any profits to the backer community. 
This update will be of significant depth. The main focus is on the files shared. Additionally, several backers have asked us ‘What happened to the smart LED?’ The answer to that question is summarized lower down, and at a deeper level within the shared folder.

Dear Backers,
In January we shared that our factory was awaiting an audit from the certification authorities and that we would provide an update when more information was made available. We are writing today to provide confirmation on Plugaway’s project status.
DECISION TO CANCEL PROJECT

Dear backers,
We are getting closer to the completion of our project, with certification on its way now, we are focusing a bit more on the software side of Plugaway; user experienced aimed beta-testing was conducted a month ago and we got loads of feedback regarding different aspects of the app. Also, we already have the packaging for Australia and China ready to go. Here is some info, plus some sneak peeks.
Plugaway on stage

Dear backers,
Offices re-opened following the national holiday in mainland China last Wednesday, and we’ve come back at a running pace. Live demonstration and certification are prioritised items on our schedule.
80 pre-certified units to be ready for demonstration

Dear backers,
We’re very happy to be able to provide positive news regarding production status on the Plugaway Project.
Conclusion from Liuyi’s visit to Shenzhen
Liuyi returned from Shenzhen on Sunday 28th, bringing in his hands the first ‘official’ Plugaway device. Following consultation with factory technicians and advisors, the factory is now prepping for the producing the first batch of units.
Forward milestones

Dear Plugaway backers,  
We are glad to announce the launch of our website later this month, where you will be able to access even more information about our products, team, partners, etc. As it is our face to the world, we are still working on the final details so it can depict us the right way.

Dear backers,   

On Sunday just past, Liuyi returned from his visit to Shenzhen. As well as providing a feedback on production status, he also shared in the local Mid-Autumn festivities. A key event in the Chinese lunar calendar, this saw consumption of a lot of moon cakes (see below)!

Dear backers,
We keep pushing forward, all thanks to your support, we can honestly say that we have great backers, backers that really have our back and support us, many of you sent messages of support and offering your help with the UI for the App and we are down with that! Just send us a message via Kickstarter and we will contact you back. Also thanks for all the ideas and suggestions, it’s great to be part of a community with such a strong flow of ideas. We want to launch the project in a functional state and then further develop it into a device which can serve as platform to the whole Smarthome movement.

Backers. You might aswell give up. No money will be returned. Kickstarter will not help or care. Crowdfunding is pure risk. You must understand that. Yes you are giving your hard earned money with the hope of something in return but in some instances it does happen and nothing will be recieved. Unfortunately from my experience this is on the rise in crowdfunding. Some do honestly run into difficulty and have exhausted all the campaign to continue with R&D Others just put a good campaign together,suck people in and run with the funds. Once Kickstarter get their slice they move on. They will not help to try and return campaign money if it turns out to be a scam or not. All I say is,if you don't understand the risks,then wait until it hits retail and stay clear of crowdfunding.

If you need mesh you had to use the plugs from other kickstarter project. There you get "Master" strips with wifi and a second radio like bluetooth LE or zigbee and "slaves" with zigbee or bluetooth LE only. The good: you don't waste IP adresses in your wifi network. You have a little network only for these devices and not all devices have to be in range of wifi. You have lower costs for slaves and less energy consumption. The bad: you have master/slaves. You have higher costs for master because of the two radios.

campaign.story:
Meet Innr
Innr is a groundbreaking new approach to interior decorating, using the magical power of light. 
Innr changes the way you experience lighting. Most of us still consider lighting in our home as a collection of lamps that produce light. But a collection of lamps doesn’t necessarily create good lighting. Innr isn’t about lamps. It’s about great lighting, for every moment and every activity in your home. 
Ever wondered how all those glossy interior design magazines manage to showcase these beautiful homes with the lighting just right?
Ever been put off by the price of a professional lighting plan? 
At Innr we believe every home deserves great lighting at every moment of the day. It’s why we’re here: to make great lighting accessible to everyone. Outside you’ve got the sun, inside you’ve got Innr. 
How does it work ?
Step 1. The online Light Advisor
At Innr.com we'll create a personal online lighting plan for you, tailored to your home: 
Simply start by sketching the dimensions of your room
Indicate where the room’s fixed features are, such as doors and windows.
Add your furniture and any beautiful belongings you’d like to accentuate.
Press enter… 
and you have your personalised lighting plan. As well as all the products you need to make it happen, ready to be delivered to your home. 
Get your personalised lighting plan in three easy steps
Step 2. Installation 
Once your order has arrived you’re ready for step two. Installation is quick and easy with the personalised lighting plan of your room and the contents of your order: state-of-the-art Innr LED spots, easy-to-install strips and bulbs, an internet bridge, and everything else needed to achieve the transformation of your room.
Step 3. The Innr experience
With the installation complete, you’re ready for the final step. After logging into your Innr account via the app on your smart device, you’ll be shown tailor-made settings for different moods and activities, based on the personal lighting plan created for your room. 
With a single screen tap you can adjust the lighting to fit your current mood or activity. For dining, relaxing, having friends round, working from home or doing homework with the kids. Innr provides great lighting for everything you do, including when you’re doing nothing much and just want to relax. 
Other Innr benefits
Where do we stand ?
What started with a vision to empower people to be able to create better lighting at home, has now materialized into fully functional software and prototypes that are ready for mass production.
The online lighting advisor has undergone numerous iterations and reviews with consumers and lighting designers to make sure that the interface is simple and the advice is top notch. We’re happy with the results so we plan to release a beta version next month.
We've built many prototypes of the lighting products so we can be sure they deliver the lighting quality and ease of installation we promise. The designs have been finalized and the first tools have been ordered. We've been really fortunate to be able to work with an international team of outstanding design partners and suppliers who have thought with us every step of the way, using their experience gained from working for leading lighting and electronics brands.
What's next ?
In four months' time we expect to deliver the first orders. While we continue to tweak the software, the biggest step now is to order tooling, start production and go through certification so that we can start shipping. Meanwhile we are working on brand development, marketing positioning, packaging, and all the other of other major details that are needed to bring Innr to life.
The planning:
November: Tool making, pilot production & certification. Beta version light advisor live
December: Start production. light advisor refinements
January: First shipments from supplier. Light advisor version 1.0 live
February: Start fulfillment Kickstarter rewards
March: All Kickstarter rewards delivered
Why Kickstarter ?
We’ve come a long way over the past year with the creation of Innr. We think it will revolutionize the way people light their homes. Your support will allow us to order tools and start up production so that we can make Innr available to you and everyone interested in personalised great lighting. More importantly, as part of the Kickstarter community, you'll not only be supporting us with crowd funding, but also with great ideas and feedback to help make Innr even better. We’re keen to receive your sharp and insightful reviews. The claim we make is a substantial one, and we really want Innr to live up to it. Use it, test it, give us your thoughts.
The rewards
 The Innr team
An international bunch who all believe in the magical power of light to enrich homes and interiors. Our vision and passion lie in the desire to change the way people experience lighting.
In our 'office'
Thanks for your support !
We’re delighted to be able to share the Innr journey with you, and hope you’ll join us in our mission to change the way people think about lighting. Help us make great, personalised lighting for every moment of the day available to everyone. And please check www.innr.com or..
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
There are always plenty of pitfalls and hurdles to overcome when truly innovating. Innr, with its technical complexity, has been no exception. The good news is that some of the biggest risks on our journey in creating Innr now lie behind us. 

We've had to develop software that can provide sound lighting advice and the results we believe in. We also wanted to develop top quality led products that are smaller than anything available on the market. To top it all, we wanted to develop a reliable wireless control system that could be programmed through the lighting advisor. We're proud to say we managed to achieve all of our objectives. Innr has been created thanks to a great team with the right experience and ambition and first-class suppliers who are ready to get going with manufacturing Innr for us. 

In the next phase the main risks are in production delays, release test hiccups and software bugs. For the most typical risks, we have identified ways to minimize them and to resolve them if they should crop up. Nevertheless, you can never eliminate sheer bad luck. So we’ve allowed for some slack in the production planning, if only to reinforce in our own belief that we’ll be able to deliver on time.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: We are a step further in making our dream come true!
updates.update_content:
Hi Innr backers,
This is the update I’ve been dreaming about for the last four weeks! Yesterday we passed the magic GBP 50,000 mark and that means we reached our Kickstarter goal. That’s all thanks to you, our backers! A BIG thank you! 
It’s hard to describe how great it feels that so many people have decided to support us. It’s a massive boost for the Innr team to see that so many people want to transform their homes with Innr. And you’ve made that possible.

Dear Friends,
During my one week trip to Hong Kong / China two weeks ago I also spent nearly a day at Design Icon, our product design agency in Hong Kong. They just moved into a new studio, nearly double the size of the previous one, much lighter and more spacious than the previous one in the same building.
Besides reviewing the first-off-tool parts and products, we spent most of our time on creating our picture-based user manuals.

updates.update_userinfo: Rob’s visit to Design Icon, our product design agency
updates.update_content:
Dear Friends,
We are still frantically testing the alpha version of our LightAdvisor, in order to move to a private beta stage soon – and we want to keep you in the loop of our progress.
We have been working on the LightAdvisor as the backbone of our concept for the larger part of this year, so we‘re pretty excited that the first fully functional version is around the corner. We are still smoothening some of the inner (Innr) workings of the application, but the main functions are there. And what’s even more important; it actually does what it says on the tin- in a simple way!

Just returned from a one week trip to Hong Kong / China to visit our development & supply partner. After more than 10 years of living in Asia, it is always great to be back and experience the frantic pace of life in this part of the world. With their high level of expertise and pragmatic ‘can do’ mentality, it’s great to work together with our Chinese friends, on whom we rely for the joint-development of our Innr range of products. Crossing the border at Lo Wu, it takes a good hour’s drive to reach the factory. After many long conference calls and endless emails, it was great to see the fully functional first off-tools of our Spot and Down light, as well as the Track and Power Supply, together forming the first complete product in our range. Clearly, some tweaking and tuning still needs to be done, but we’re nearly there and hope to start production in December.

Tucked away in a corner of our offices, you'll find one of our secret weapons; the demo room. With a little help from the local IKEA store, we built a life-size living room that we are using for real-life tests of our products and software. This was an excellent opportunity to put the Innr light advisor to work, using it to create a good lighting plan for our demo room. With the plan we knew exactly what lights we needed and where to install them.  
This picture shows the floor plan of our demo room:
Now that we had a good lighting plan, we went ahead and installed our precious prototypes according to the plan. Our next big test was to see how our lighting system worked with the Innr control app on our phones. And we’re happy to say that it works as advertised, on all mobile phone platforms, even when we’re all using the app at the same time.

updates.update_userinfo: Rob's visit to our development and supply partner
updates.update_content:
Racing from one meeting to the next. Meetings about crowd funding or branding, user interface or project planning, about funding or staffing. As director of a startup, you hardly have time for a cup of coffee, let alone going back 18 months in time. Yet I clearly remember how and where the dream began. And who was with me. It's good to occasionally think back to that time during all the hectic day-to-day moments.
I worked as Head of the Lighting Division for Philips Japan. I was visiting one of our key clients, a manufacturer of professional luminaires as well as a supplier of complete lighting projects. They demonstrated one of their lighting systems in their showroom. That was a true WOW moment! The magic they created by transforming a functional home office to homely and romantic living space was just unbelievable. The man who was demonstrating told me: "Jeroen-san, everyone can make lamps. The difference is in the lighting design. It's not about the lamps and fixtures; it’s about the light.” I became even more enthusiastic when he showed me his pride and joy: a room full of lighting designers.

campaign.story:
Chesstache is Laura Landry and Spencer Anastasio, two friends who are obchessed. One night over drinks he taught her chess and shared with her his idea for a burlap, drawstring bag chessboard that he could easily carry with him anywhere. As a part of her ‘homemade’ Christmas in 2012, she made her version of his idea and together they decided to make this ‘thing’ happen. The name was easy, it was a chessboard you could stash and with her new found love of chess and her never ending love of mustaches, it was quickly named the Chesstache. Next the logo took shape; the rook being his favorite piece and the mustache, well... that was her. From there it was an evolution... Together they’ve developed what they believe is a product that will change how the game is played because it will change WHERE the game is played. Without further adieu, this is Chesstache.
Our mission at Chesstache is to introduce chess to a new audience or reintroduce it to those who may have forgotten. It is our goal to upcycle, reclaim, repurpose, and use minimal packaging wherever possible; convenience, style and mobility with an extremely low profile. Through the development of our handcrafted chessboards we believe we can make chess playable everywhere; from the coffee shop to the campground and everywhere in between. Each Chesstache will have its own personality and unique sense of culture-conscious style. Almost every step in production is done by hand and EVERYTHING is made in the USA. These points of difference will continue to be the driving force behind the development of our brand and goods.
The two boards currently available are made of cotton canvas. Specifically, repurposed Korean War and Vietnam War era military tarps and tents (The McArthur), and black cotton duck canvas (The Lincoln). We chose cotton canvas because of its durability and ability to withstand the test of time. We are looking to utilize additional fabrics in the development of future board styles, including mylar boat sails (The Hemingway) and leather (The Winchester), and we will continue to source other durable fabrics to make new boards from.
The squares are screen printed onto the boards using a flexible paint that will not crack or peel with the repeated folding and rolling of the board.
Do you have an idea for a fabric you would like to see the Chesstache in? Are we missing your favorite color for the squares? Let us know (info@chesstache.com or post a comment here on Kickstarter), we’d love to hear from you - you just might be the inspiration for a future board.
In order to make the Chesstache ultraportable we knew we had to rethink the traditional chess pieces. Originally inspired by Scrabble tiles, we set out to make our pieces out of round, flat, wood discs that we would stain and decorate with the shape or name of the chess piece. As our idea evolved we looked for a more substantial wood than the balsa, used for Scrabble tiles, and decided to source maple from Maine to make the Chesstache pieces. The final pieces will be stained, tumbled, and waxed with the shape of each piece heat branded into the wood.
The pieces are stacked in ‘The Stache’, a durable, soft-touch (rubberized) plastic tube with removable endcaps. The board is then wrapped around it and secured with a leather strap and buckle.
The images that you see below and on the video are only prototypes, The Stache and pieces are still in development and we are anticipating pictures of their final design in the coming days. We’re really looking forward to sharing them with you.
Each board will have a Chesstache label sewn into the side and include a leather strap  and buckle designed to match the style of board it will secure. The Chesstache will utilize minimal outer packaging, which will be consistent for both e-commerce and brick and mortar store sales.
From the first burlap board that Laura made to where the product is today, it’s been an evolution. We’ve tested and retested, designed and redesigned. Below we’ve shared a collection of pictures to illustrate the evolution the Chesstache has gone through.
The Chesstache has been busy, here are a few pics of its adventures...
The below graphic demonstrates how we will allocate your funding according to our business model.
The boards you may choose from are pictured below with renderings of the pint glass koozie and decals. You will notice a few levels of rewards seem to be the same. We've used what we call diminishing rewards to encourage early pledging. For example, on "The Obchessed" the first 15 backers at this level will get their reward for $65, the next 25 backers will get the same reward for $75, for the next 50 backers it's $85, and all other backers will receive the same reward for $95. This also applies to "The Gift & Take".
Follow us on:
chesstache.com
Facebook
Twitter
Instagram
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Challenge: This is our first experience owning and running a company. We believe however that our combined skill sets allow us to perform nearly all of the necessary functions within our organization, reducing the need to outsource to third parties. 

“I spent the past decade as a cosmetic executive with experience in sales, education, promotions, e-commerce, product development, and procurement within the upscale and luxury retail environments. Expressing my creative nature is compulsive and ranges from chessboards to vegetable gardens to graphic design. Its not a question of will I create, it’s a question of what I create. Along with my professional acumen and innate creativity I bring to Chesstache my sense of unexpected, niche consumer goods.” – Laura

 “My legal background was especially useful in the initial stages of setting up Chesstache LLC and securing rights in our intellectual property. This will continue to serve the organization well into the future, as we are able to minimize legal fees. My familiarity in the backcountry combined with my experience as a whitewater rafting guide and ski instructor lends itself to an ability to conceptualize innovative outdoor and travel products. Also having held positions across many industries I am able to quickly adapt and learn new skill sets for the job at hand.” – Spencer

Risk: As a scarce resource there is a finite quantity of the historical canvases we are interested in using. We will look to source as much as possible but understand that we do face some limitations and new fabrics will need to be found. We also think that this fact lends itself to the uniqueness of our product.

Challenge: Currently there are four hands that make Chesstaches (Laura’s and Spencer’s). Production and fulfillment of the Kickstarter orders may prove to be a challenge depending on the response to our product. The custom components we will outsource (The Stache and the pieces) will take six to eight weeks to arrive. We will use this downtime to produce the boards so that order fulfillment happens in a timely manner.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Your response to receiving your Chesstaches has me feeling pumped up. Packaged up another 29 boards tonight. Settling into a game over The Chesstache with a glass of scotch.
Stay Obchessed, LL

Please post a picture of you and your Chesstache on Facebook www.facebook/chesstache or on Twitter or Instagram and tag using @chesstache
Best, LL

Hi all,
Boards should start to be delivered today. I'm shipping about 20 a day and will finish shipments by next Monday. All deliveries should be made by end of next week.
Now that boards are arriving to you, I wanted to let you know about the final design...
I went with an exposed serged edge rather than the rolled edge of our prototype, because it allows for the board to lay perfectly flat and better roll around The Stache. The rolled edge was too bulky.
Caps have finally arrived and tomorrow packages start shipping. Thanks for your patience!

Organizing 5,064 pieces of wood for your orders tonight. Prepping for assembly to begin Monday!!!
Always Obchessed, LL
Assembly of the Chesstache sets will begin on Monday now that the wood has arrived!!

Hey guys,
Great news, the wood is finally done and I will pick it up on Friday!! It will take me a several days to assemble the sets, but I am hoping to start shipping mid to late next week.
I'll post a picture of the wood once I have it in hand.
Always Obchessed, LL

Hi all,
Things are coming together nicely, although I am not quite done yet. I've attached pictures of all of the completed components (boards, belts, The Staches, the numbered certificates, and outer cartons), the last outstanding component is still the wood. I'm asking for your patience for a couple more weeks, looking to ship early December so you guys have these by Christmas. If you purchased an extra board as a gift I will ship it to a secondary address at no additional charge.

Hello backers,
I would like to update everyone on the current status of Chesstache. I have bought out my former partner Spencer's interest in the business and will continue on as sole owner of the company.
As I approach my projected October 1 shipping date I find myself with the hard task of updating you with another postponement. The lesson of higher costs and time delays is a hard one that I know many Kickstarter projects have had to learn.

Here's a sneak peek of the wood. All the various components will be coming in within the next week and we'll send pics as they arrive.
We were able to source an American made plastic for The Stache, it's at the printer now. Can't wait to show you!! You won't be disappointed.
Always Obchessed, Laura & Spencer

campaign.story:
Between Earth & Void will be the first time I'm showing my works in public. My exhibition will be at The Factory, a charming pop-up gallery/café that serves amazing homemade ice-creams and mean fries! We plan for the show to last a month, featuring selected works from my 7 Elements series. 
Making Between Earth and Void happen is really important to me. I’m at the proverbial crossroads in life where I want to take that leap of faith and dedicate myself to professional art-making. Your support is crucial to giving me the courage to make this big step.
I’m a prodigal son who’s returning to my art, having put it aside for 15 years - first to read psychology in university then for a career as a commercial writer. My homecoming was inspired by various friends who roped me into helping with their creative projects over the years. Their passion and energy fired me with a sense of possibility. The passing of a dear friend was the wake up call I needed to ask myself what I really wanted out of life.
For the past 7 years I’ve been channeling time, energy, and effort into my art in the evenings while continuing with my day job in the office. I've now completed 2 series of works and have started working on the 3rd. (7 Elements is actually my second series although the first to be shown publicly).
Ren Zi working on "7 Elements"
Early experiments for the first series
7 Elements is about how we are changed by memories. For me, elements are not fixed states but states of change. My works depict how we are affected by our memories and the changes wrought by time. I've been working on 7 Elements  for the past 18 months. After countless experiments with printing techniques and materials including aluminum, light-boxes and various mixed media, I’ve finally completed a series I’m happy with and produced a set of artist’s proofs.
Here are some of the works that you’ll see in the show:
"Void #2" (2012), digital print on bamboo paper, 80 x 80 cm, artist's proof
"Portal" (2012), digital print on bamboo paper, 80 x 80 cm, artist's proof
"Earth #3" (2012), digital print on bamboo paper, 80 x 80 cm, artist's proof
"Void #1" (2012), digital print on bamboo paper, 80 x 80 cm, artist's proof
"Void #1", gold leaf overlay (detail)
Now comes the final phase of producing the actual prints and staging the show. That's where you come in. The funds raised from Kickstarter will go towards producing the final prints in signed and numbered editions of 6, and the costs of holding my first public exhibition at The Factory. Each work will be printed on archival-quality bamboo paper, measuring 80 x 80 cm. I chose bamboo paper for its beautiful texture. It brings out the soul of the works. It’s also tough and resilient to humidity change, which preserves their beauty. 
I'm excited about bringing my works out of the studio into the public eye and getting feedback from the audience.
My dream is to devote myself to a full-time art practice. With your support, I’ll be able to make the transition sooner!
- Ren Zi
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The foremost issue for most people is knowing whether the show will actually happen. You'll be invited to opening night (if you're in town & have pledged $10 or more) and be able to enjoy the show in person. We'll also be posting pictures here to share the happenings with you.
 
Another challenge would be my ability to send Kickstarter supporters their well-deserved gifts within the schedule we're aiming for, should funding come through. This is especially for “Remixed Memories”, which I'll be working on after work. This is ever-dependent on my workload in the office, over which I've little control. Should I miss the end May deadline, do indulge me with your patience. We'll keep you updated on my progress on this project page, and I'll be working hard to get your gifts to you as soon as possible!
 
We're working out different shipping options. We're planning to send my gifts via registered post as we want assurance that they'll get to where they should be in good condition. Also, we'll also be liaising with overseas supporters to work out your postage cost, which will depend on your shipping preferences.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: closing the chapter... with new works!
updates.update_content:
the gifts have finally been mailed out or collected, which brings a bittersweet close to an exciting project.
far from twiddling my thumbs i've been producing on new works for the "7 elements" series. 4 of which, in addition to "portal", are available for sale on the artling
this would be my final post on kickstarter. drop in on my blog ren-zi.com for updates. thanks a million, everyone!!!

it was amazing fun thinking up the "remixed" series. here they are, laying out to dry. what's next? final q.c., packing & have them ready for distribution mid-next week. then it's on to the $500 tier supporters. whoopee!!!
2 solid weeks logged on the "remix" series. sketching, drawing, sampling paper, more drawing. looking forward to how they'll turn out.

We kicked off the exhibition with the Preview Evening last Friday. I was overwhelmed by the strong showing, made more awesome with the presence of several Kickstarter supporters & being able to thank them in person. By evening's end, 8 of the 15 available pieces were already spoken for!
We couldn't have done it without you. Heartfelt thanks to everyone! Vielen Dank! Mucho gracias! どうもありがとうございました！感谢大家的支持！

8 more days. One of my aims of getting on Kickstarter is to share my works with as many people as we can. So I'm counting on you to help spread the word! YES... Still time to get friends & friends of friends on board -- and invited to Opening Night!
It's YOUR party as much as mine -- without YOU, none of this would've been possible! :D

updates.update_userinfo: A week and a day to go!
updates.update_content:
While the country shuts down for the holidays, work continues. All worth it! :)
After days of fiddling, I'm finally satisfied with how the granulated glass has been applied to void #2. Also, the Swarovski crystals on earth #2 are giving the star field a subtle "pop."
More support came in while we were posting our update! SUPER ENORMOUS THANK YOU!!!
3 days in. We're already more than 1/2 way to our target! A huge thank you to all our supporters! Really appreciate everyone spreading the word. 50% more to go! :)

campaign.story:
To support us, click "Back this Project" on the right, or click directly on any of the available rewards (Like the CINCH wallet :: Stainless Steel)
Are you looking to trade in that overly stuffed and morbidly obese pain in the back wallet for an easy everyday carry? For all you minimalist lovers who believe less is more, we have the remedy! Birth out of a need (good-bye money clips, broccoli rubber bands and bulky wallets) we are proud to introduce you to CINCH; an American crafted, industrial style, minimalist wallet that simplifies your life and your pockets. Let the battle against the bulge begin! CINCH say “Hello” to the Kickstarter community, don’t be shy.
Friends it's time to slim down, lighten up those pockets and retire that swelled George Costanza wallet bursting at the seams with credit cards, old receipts, ticket stubs and expired coupons. It's a dawn of a new era and the CINCH is helping to stylishly pave the way by hugging and holding all your essential cards and cash. Proof that form and function can co-exist! With its low profile design the CINCH minimalist wallet easily fits in your front or back pocket, however you carry #CINCHworks! (Stainless steel recommended for back pocket and SS or Oak recommended for front pocket)
When you hold the CINCH wallet for the first time you will get to experience something real, something substantial, something uniquely different and functional. The CINCH is basic, essential & to be cherished. Within your hand you will be holding an amazingly beautiful and strong Oak or Stainless Steel 'Backbone' wrapped with a tight black elastic 'Keeper' to secure your cards/cash that provides a firm and satisfying grasp. When you place CINCH in your pocket you will have the satisfaction of knowing YOU helped make it happen!

We offer two versions: Oak and Stainless Steel.
Our sleek metal version features a Stainless Steel 'Backbone' with integrated bottle opener and black elastic 'Keeper' Produced via laser cutting, which results in very low waste and high yield. (Offered for $5 off retail)
CINCH™ :: Stainless Backbone [w/ integrated bottle opener] & Black Keeper
Our wood version is made from 100% salvaged or ethically sourced, sustainable wood and features an Oak 'Backbone' and black elastic 'Keeper'; each Oak CINCH is finished with environmentally friendly, non-toxic tung oil. (Offered for $5 off retail)
CINCH™ :: Oak 'Backbone' & black elastic 'Keeper'
A Craftsman's Tale
Portsmith Co. was born in a city steep in a rich history of lumber, craftsmen, hard workers, innovators, businessmen and idea-smiths. The Portsmith Co. name pays homage to that rich history. Portsmith Co. strives to carry on the tradition of passing along fine-crafted essential goods to improve ones life.
We desire to be here for the long haul, aspiring to be a 100 year old company doing what we love; creating minimalistic, quality goods made from the finest and most basic of materials; wood & stainless steel. We design and make life essentials for you that are honestly crafted, well made and well loved! We began our journey with our Ecoustik iPhone & iPad docks and now continue it on with our CINCH minimalist wallet, but this is only the beginning. By pledging your support you are not just buying a product you are helping us with our journey and being part of our story. Thanks for helping craft our dream into reality!
CINCH™ :: Oak 'Backbone'
The CINCH minimalist wallet is designed in-house & expertly crafted by skilled American woodworkers, metal-smiths & seamstresses to produce our exceptional product. Our innovative products are born out of a need and love of thoughtful design, originality and craftsmanship. Want to know more? Read our About Us page.

What are CINCHers saying?
"...it won’t make your butt look big in those jeans." - Werd.com

"A swollen, Costanza-style wallet is just not practical.
Try this minimalist Cinch." - Fantasthing.com

"Your back, butt, and bank roll will thank you." - ecosnobberysucks.com"Can your cow’s ass wallet do that? Not bloody likely!" - Headlines & Heroes
"The overall winner is…. The CINCH minimalist wallet!!!"  - examiner.com
Overall winner of the Examiner.com Alternative Wallet Roundup.

Craft beer anyone? With the CINCH wallet, opening a bottle is literally an arms length away and popping the cap couldn't be easier with this perfectly designed Stainless Steel 'Backbone.' As we say: "In a pinch, use a CINCH" - You will never again be holding a frosty beverage with no way to open it.

The CINCH minimalist wallet has many uses and we keep discovering more. Tired of tangled cables? Yeah...we are too! The CINCH can keep your earbuds neatly stowed when you tuck the ends into the 'Keeper.' Curious what else you can use your CINCH for? Check out #CINCHworks on twitter and instagram or our Facebook page.

CINCH :: minimalist wallet in action at Alabaster Coffee Roaster & Tea Company. Features: CINCH Stainless Steel Backbone™ [w/ integrated bottle opener]
CINCH: minimalist wallet - Customer review
Joshua, Melissa, Michael, Wendy & Adam
For the love of all things well made we truly respect and care about everyone we work with, the materials used and every design detail that goes into creating our artisan made goods. It's all in the details! With our keen eye for design and attention to detail we are able to make products that both you and Portsmith Co. can be proud of. We strive to constantly improve the way we do business to the delight of our customers. As forward thinkers (with an appreciation for the past) we are always looking for ways to improve our products and make our processes better for all involved. As perfectionist we set the benchmark very high for ourselves and strongly believe that there is always room for improvement, and always room to grow.

//______________ \\
Production Schedule
\\------------------------//
Mid February: CINCH :: minimalist wallet Kickstarter ends
Mid February: CINCH fabrication begins
Early March: CINCH production complete
Mid March: CINCH product assembly/packaging
End March: CINCH shipping
Early April: CINCH delivery and happiness ensues

What do we need the money for?
Up until know we have only been able to produce small batches of CINCH, hand finished and assembled in house. We have sold a limited amount of CINCH and obtained valuable feedback from our loyal CINCHer's. One thing is for sure...people LOVE the CINCH and they aren't shy to tell us about it. Our customers are so passionate that they let us know their ideas on how to make the CINCH better. The people have spoken and we have listened! We have heard the improvement suggestions, incorporated them and and now we need your help to take this to the next level, increase production and get the CINCH into your pockets to simplify your life. Help us craft our dream! Your pledge will allow us to produce an amazing American crafted product that meets our highest standard of quality, and bring the CINCH to market. We promise to make design-inspired, solution-driven, handcrafted goods of the highest quality that simplifies and enriches your life as well as the world in which we live.

Specifics: We always strive to refine and perfect our products. Every product we make has personality and is the result of hands-on testing, reconfiguring, finessing and finishing. We are going to post updates throughout the entire Kickstarter project to keep you informed. With a fully funded Kickstarter project we will:

1. Contract manufactures to make use of more craftsmen, woodworkers and seamstresses in order to bring our product to market. USA Jobs!!!
2. Laser etch a rad Anvil brand mark into the oak and metal 'Backbones.'
3. Tighten up design, production, finish and packaging in order to provide you the best possible quality product.
4. Address administrative & managerial needs
5. Purchase needed production & office equipment
6. Put out a finished product that gets the Portsmith Co. seal of approval.
7. And other Rad things to wow you!

**Our products are handcrafted with love - not molded by robots in far away lands. Each Oak 'Backbone' is made from ethically sourced, sustainable wood that tells it's own tale, each one has unique wood grain.**

PLANTING A SEED

At Portsmith Co. we understand how important our role is in leading social change and desire to put our best foot forward by lowering our carbon footprint. But we know we can’t do it alone and need your help! In purchasing our totally unique handcrafted wood creations you are contributing to valuable reforestation efforts and helping us to cultivate a sustainable future. In order to lessen our ecological impact and promote sustainability we started a 1for1 program where we plant 1 tree for every board foot (12″ x 12″ x 1″) used to produce our wooden CINCH Backbones and our other wood designed products. It’s our way to ensure the environment is thriving and remains in balance for many years to come. Thanks for helping us plant, promote and protect our most renewable resource!
This Kickstarter is powered by Awesomeness! (YOU!)

SHARE THE LOVE: Sharing is caring and you can do it in a 'CINCH'! Thanks for your seal of approval and for being RAD! Join the Portsmith Co. Family & help make CINCH a revolution.
(Click the share buttons at the top of this page.)
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is not our first Kickstarter rodeo. Because of your support we have previously launched two successful kickstarter projects. [ http://kck.st/ZZX0AY & http://kck.st/W86yIg ] And thanks to you we are now back for our third. That said we are no strangers to production risks and challenges. From sourcing materials to working with skilled craftsmen and metal smiths we learned how to overcome the many challenges of product design from our previous products. 

This does not mean there are not any risks. We will have to source the highest quality materials used in production and maintain a ridiculously high standard of excellence that we hold ourselves to. In order to overcome these challenges we will stay in close communications with our local craftsmen. Throughout the production process we will ensure that what is produced deserves our Portsmith Co. seal of approval.

Another challenge we could see ourselves facing is fulfillment. If you love our CINCH wallet, and we hope you do, and you tell all your friends and we get flooded with pledges that could delay delivery due to shear volume. To make sure this challenge is minimized we have talked to our craftsman and they have ensured us they are up to the task. Know that if any delays did occur we will update you at every step because we value you and your satisfaction is crucial to our longevity. 

We really appreciate your support and thanks again to Kickstarter for having us back.

Thanks for being Rad!
The Portsmith Co. Team
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
